0.title: Gadkari removed from BJP's Parliamentary Board due to his rising stature: NCP
0.article_body: The NCP reacted to BJP dropping Union Minister Nitin Gadkari from its Parliamentary Board and said that the party removed him due to his rising stature as an "astute politician". "When your calibre and capabilities grow and you pose a challenge to the higher ups the BJP downsizes you. The tainted get upgraded," NCP Spokesperson Clyde Crasto said on Twitter.

1.title: Billionaire Jim Ratcliffe interested in buying Manchester United: Report
1.article_body: British billionaire Jim Ratcliffe is reportedly interested in buying Manchester United. After a report emerged claiming that the Glazer family may consider selling a stake in the club, a spokesperson for Ratcliffe said, "If the club is for sale, Jim is definitely a potential buyer." Earlier on Wednesday, the world's richest person Elon Musk had joked about buying Manchester United.

2.title: I was like 'Why is the script so bad?': Karan Johar on 'Student of the Year'
2.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar revealed he had second thoughts about making Sidharth Malhotra-starrer 'Student of the Year'. Karan said he asked his creative director, "Why are we making this film? Have you read the script?" He added, "I started shooting for the film...I was like, 'Why is the script so bad?'." Karan said the film was "very different" from the script.

3.title: Pune city likely to witness light rainfall till August 20: IMD
3.article_body: Pune city is likely to witness light rainfall till August 20, India Meteorological Department (IMD) officials said. "There is no warning issued for city or ghat regions for August 19 and August 20. However, rainfall activity in ghat regions is likely to pick up pace," IMD stated. A 'yellow' alert has been issued for ghat regions around Pune for Thursday.

4.title: Gambling racket busted in Bengaluru; 13 arrested, over ₹1 lakh seized
4.article_body: The City Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru Police on Wednesday arrested 13 persons in connection with an illegal gambling racket and seized cash worth over ₹1 lakh from them. According to police, the accused were engaged in 'Andar Bahar' games. The incident occurred within the Kodigehalli police station limits, Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime) Raman Gupta tweeted.

5.title: Delhi LG recommends action against IAS officer for accepting bribe
5.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena wrote to the Ministry of Home Affairs seeking action against IAS officer Udit Prakash Rai for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹50 lakh. Prakash allegedly took the bribe for extending "undue favours" to an executive engineer by diluting punishment against him in two corruption cases. Rai is the Delhi Health and Family Welfare Special Secretary.

6.title: Truck mows down couple going for a TV serial shoot in Mumbai
6.article_body: A couple, working for a television production house in Mumbai, died after a speeding dumper truck crashed into their motorcycle from behind, crushing them under the front wheel. The deceased, identified as Nazir Shah (39) and Chaaya Khillari (38), were on their way to Mira Road for shooting a television serial when the accident occurred near Sanjay Gandhi National Park.

7.title: List of world's most polluted cities released; Delhi tops
7.article_body: Delhi and Kolkata are the two most polluted cities in the world in terms of average annual population-weighted PM 2.5 exposure, according to the Health Effects Institute's State of Global Air Initiative. Nigeria's Kano, Peru's Lima, Dhaka, Jakarta, Nigeria's Lagos, Karachi, Beijing and Ghana's Accra are in the top ten. Mumbai has been ranked 14.

8.title: Putin to award Russian mothers $16,000 if they have 10 or more kids
8.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has revived the Soviet-era award of 'Mother Heroine' as the country grapples with a demographic crisis. The title will be bestowed on women who bear and raise 10 or more children. Qualifying mothers will be awarded a one-time payment of 1 million rubles (about $16,000) as soon as their 10th living child turns one year old.

9.title: Man booked for cheating Pune lawyer of 220 bitcoins worth ₹42 crore
9.article_body: Pune Police on Tuesday arrested a man for allegedly cheating a lawyer of 220 bitcoins worth ₹42 crore. The victim had invested ₹49 lakh in 54 bitcoins and the accused assured him a return of 166 bitcoins. However, he was allegedly made to reinvest in various Ponzi schemes, according to police officials.

10.title: 3 Mumbai residents lose a total of ₹3.80 lakh to electricity bill fraud
10.article_body: In separate incidents, three people in Mumbai were cheated of a total of ₹3.80 lakh after falling prey to fake electricity bill messages sent by cyber-fraudsters. In two of the three incidents, victims were cheated after they received a message from Adani Electricity Mumbai Limited. The third incident took place after a woman received a message from the electricity department.

11.title: Born to produce films: Charmee on quitting acting to become producer
11.article_body: 'Liger' producer Charmme Kaur said she decided to quit acting to embrace ageing. "I'd get wrinkles, I would become fat and it is normal and that's the reason I wanted to shift out of it while I was still at the peak of my career," she said. Charmme said she "was born to produce films and nothing else".

12.title: Centre was 'secretly' trying to give residence to Rohingyas in Delhi: Sisodia
12.article_body: After the mix-up over Rohingya refugees' accommodation, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia alleged that the central government was "secretly" trying to give "permanent residence" to Rohingya refugees in Delhi. He said the Centre was calling the move to shift Rohingyas to EWS flats an "achievement", but later started shifting the blame on Delhi government after Aam Aadmi Party opposed it.

13.title: Explosion hits Kabul mosque shattering windows in nearby buildings, casualties feared
13.article_body: A huge explosion struck a mosque in Kabul during evening prayers on Wednesday, witnesses and police said, with many feared dead or injured. Police said there were multiple casualties but did not say how many. Al Jazeera quoted an unidentified official as giving a death toll of 20. Witnesses said the explosion shattered windows in nearby buildings.

14.title: Faisal Shaikh to participate in 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10': Reports
14.article_body: Social media influencer Faisal Shaikh, also known as Mr Faisu, has signed another reality show. The actor, who is currently seen on 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12', will be reportedly participating in the upcoming dance reality show 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10'. The show, hosted by Maniesh Paul, will see Karan Johar, Madhuri Dixit and Nora Fatehi as the judges.

15.title: Don't want to be called 'Punjab Ki Katrina Kaif' anymore: Shehnaaz
15.article_body: Shehnaaz Gill said she now prefers to be called "Shehnaaz from India". She said, "I don't want to be Punjab Ki Katrina Kaif. I just want to be Shehnaaz Gill from India." The title 'Punjab Ki Katrina Kaif' was coined by Shehnaaz on 'Bigg Boss 13'. Earlier, she shared that the title suits Katrina more as she married Vicky Kaushal.

16.title: Don Anant Singh's aide made Bihar Law Minister: RK Singh on Kartikeya
16.article_body: Union Minister RK Singh on Wednesday said that RJD leader Kartikeya Singh, who faces an arrest warrant in a kidnapping case, should be removed from Bihar Cabinet. Further, he questioned, "How has Kartikeya...been made Law Minister [even thought he's] the right hand of Anant Singh, who is a don?" The minister said that "Jungle raj part-2" is back in Bihar.

17.title: 5 Bangladeshi militants sentenced to death for 2015 bombing
17.article_body: Five militants of the banned outfit Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) were sentenced to death on Wednesday for bombing a mosque inside a Navy installation in Chattogram in 2015. The Anti-Terrorism Tribunal judge said bombing inside a naval base was tantamount to attacking Bangladesh's sovereignty. Four of the convicts were present for trial, while one was tried in absentia.

18.title: Man asks Jaishankar how to change Indians' mentality for Chinese products, he replies
18.article_body: A member of Indian diaspora in Bangkok asked EAM S Jaishankar how Indians' mentality can be changed to avoid Chinese products. He replied, "Kind of support...MSMEs should've got in India...in 1990s didn't take place." "You've to give people an alternative...It'll happen when there are good Indian products...Aatmanirbhar Bharat is also about overcoming...colonial mentality," he added.

19.title: UP MLA Azam Khan booked for threatening witness in land grab case
19.article_body: Samajwadi Party MLA Azam Khan on Wednesday was booked for allegedly threatening a witness in a land grab case in which he is an accused. "An FIR has been lodged against Azam Khan and five other unidentified persons for threatening a witness of a case," said police officer Ashok Kumar. The case is being heard at an MP/MLA court.

20.title: Portfolio distribution in Bihar done without logic: Ghulam Nabi Azad
20.article_body: Raising questions over the new ministerial berths in Bihar, senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad said that the portfolio distribution was done without any logic. He said while the formation of the government was a welcome step, Congress got a raw deal. "It is really surprising that no one from the party pressed for equal share of berths," he added.

21.title: PhysicsWallah acquihires edtech startup FreeCo
21.article_body: Edtech unicorn PhysicsWallah has acquihired doubt-solving edtech and resource management firm FreeCo. PhysicsWallah and FreeCo will collaborate on the content library, and the firm plans to use FreeCo's team experience and will employ 15 members from the latter. PhysicsWallah became India's 101st unicorn after it raised $100 million in its Series A funding round in June 2021.

22.title: J&K to get 25 lakh new voters in revised list: Poll official
22.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir will get about 25 lakh new voters, including outsiders, after the special summary revision of electoral rolls is completed, Jammu and Kashmir Chief Electoral Officer Hirdesh Kumar said on Wednesday. The rolls are being revised for the first time after Article 370 was abrogated in the erstwhile state. The revision is set for completion by November 25.

23.title: 3 arrested in Agra for allegedly raising anti-India slogans
23.article_body: Three people have been arrested in Agra for allegedly raising anti-India slogans during a 'Tiranga yatra' in Gokulpura area on Independence Day, the police said. A case has been registered under Section 153-B (causing disharmony) of the Indian Penal Code against Faizan, Sadab and Muhajjam, and all three have been arrested. The miscreants are aged between 19 to 21 years.

24.title: Bilkis Bano issues statement as 11 convicts in gangrape case walk free, says 'I'm numb'
24.article_body: Bilkis Bano, in a statement issued after 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment for gangraping her and killing seven members of her family walked free, said, "The trauma...washed over me again...I'm...numb." "I appeal to...Gujarat government...Give me back my right to live without fear and in peace," she added. Bilkis stated no one enquired about her safety before taking this decision.

25.title: Russia unveils model of new space station, pic surfaces
25.article_body: Russia's space agency has unveiled a physical model of what a planned new Russian-built space station will look like. The model dubbed 'ROSS' by Russian state media was presented at 'Army-2022', a military-industrial exhibition outside Moscow. Earlier, the space agency's chief had said that Russia will quit the ISS after 2024 and is working to develop its own orbital station.

26.title: Investment firm Stride Ventures raises $200 mn to lend to startups
26.article_body: Venture debt firm, Stride Ventures announced the close of 'Stride Ventures India Fund II'. The capital was raised from banks, family offices, corporate treasuries, sovereign funds, private equity funds, insurance firms and high networth individuals. The fund's portfolio includes CredAvenue (Yubi), MyGlamm, Zepto, BluSmart, among others and it has disbursed over ₹1,600 crore in 70+ firms.

27.title: Land acquisition delays Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project
27.article_body: Slow land acquisition could delay the completion of the Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project, a report said on Wednesday. According to the Railways Ministry, 75.25% of the project's land has been acquired in Maharashtra, 98.8% in Gujarat and 100% in Dadra and Nagar Haveli. The bullet train project, which was initially set for completion by 2023, has had several deadline extensions.

28.title: Delhi sees 1,652 new COVID cases, positivity rate drops to 9.92% from 19.20%
28.article_body: Delhi reported 1,652 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday as compared to 917 cases recorded on Tuesday, while the positivity rate dropped to 9.92% from 19.20%. The national capital also reported eight deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, according to the health department's latest bulletin. As many as 1,702 patients recovered in the last 24 hours.

29.title: I eat to 90% of my stomach's capacity, I don't consume sugar, gluten: Virat Kohli
29.article_body: Talking about his diet in a recent interview with Indian Express, Virat Kohli said, "The dos and don'ts for me are quite simple— no processed sugar, no gluten." He added, "I also avoid dairy as much as possible. Another trick that has helped me keep my health in check is to eat to 90 per cent of my stomach's capacity."

30.title: Alia and I once drunk-dialled Vicky before his wedding with Katrina: Karan Johar
30.article_body: Karan Johar, during an episode of 'Koffee With Karan', revealed how he and Alia Bhatt drunk-dialled Vicky Kaushal ahead of his wedding with Katrina Kaif. "Alia and I...drunk-dialled Vicky. We were drinking wine and star gazing, and...we were wondering who we could call," he stated. "We...have known Katrina for a long time...Her getting married made us so emotional," Karan added.

31.title: List of gifts worth over ₹5 crore received by Jacqueline from conman Sukesh surfaces
31.article_body: Jacqueline Fernandez, who has been named as accused in a ₹200 crore money laundering case, received designer bags from Gucci and Chanel, shoes from Louis Vuitton and Christian Louboutin, four cats and diamond jewellery from conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar. She also got a Mini Cooper and diamond bracelet among other gifts. ED alleged Chandrasekhar gave Fernandez gifts worth over ₹5 crore.

32.title: 'Trapped' Shinde-faction MLAs are contacting us: Aaditya Thackeray
32.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Wednesday claimed "trapped" legislators in the Eknath Shinde-led faction of the party were contacting supporters of Uddhav Thackeray after the Maharashtra Cabinet was expanded last week. He said, "Our doors are open for all who want to join us back." All defectors must quit as MLAs and prepare for re-elections, Aaditya added.

33.title: Hardeep Puri trolled by Amit Shah: Congress leader on Rohingya row
33.article_body: Commenting on the mix-up between Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri and the Home Ministry over the accommodation of Rohingya refugees in Delhi, Congress leader Supriya Shrinate tweeted, "[Puri's] words turned out to be completely wrong. We're not saying this, the Home Minister himself is saying it." Shrinate added, "Poor Mr...Puri, you've been trolled by your own Home Minister Amit Shah."

34.title: Bilkis Bano rape convicts greeted with garlands at VHP office in Guj
34.article_body: The Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) on Wednesday reportedly greeted convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case with garlands at its office in Gujarat. Pictures of the garlanded convicts have emerged on social media. The 11 convicts, sentenced to life imprisonment, were released from jail in Gujarat on Monday. Their relatives touched their feet and offered them sweets after their release.

35.title: 2 UP policemen taken off duty for dancing in uniform on I-Day
35.article_body: Two Uttar Pradesh policemen were taken off duty for dancing in their uniform on Independence Day during the celebrations, an official said. Pilibhit Superintendent of Police Dinesh Kumar P, sent SI Saurabh Kumar and constable Anuj to police lines, after a video of the duo was shared. The SP has asked circle officer of the area to probe the matter.

36.title: Class 6 boy gets locked inside school toilet for 19 hrs, headmaster held
36.article_body: Police have arrested the headmaster of a school, after a class 6 student of a primary school in UP's Auraiya district was left locked in the school toilet for 19 hours on August 5. Police said the headmaster was arrested for keeping the incident under wraps and allegedly tried to bribe the family to not file a complaint.

37.title: 4 killed, 3 injured due to lightning in Andhra Pradesh's Eluru
37.article_body: Four labourers were killed due to a lightning strike in Andhra Pradesh's Eluru while they were working in the district reserve forest, police said. Three others were reportedly injured and shifted to the hospital. The deceased were identified as 35-year-old Kondababu, 20-year-old Dharmaraju, 25-year-old Raju and 18-year-old Venu, whose bodies were sent to Eluru hospital for postmortem.

38.title: Israel, Turkey to re-establish full diplomatic relations
38.article_body: Israel and Turkey will re-establish full diplomatic relations and exchange ambassadors, the Israeli Prime Minister's office said on Wednesday. The two countries, who were formerly close, had a falling-out in 2010 over the Israel-Palestine conflict. Israel's caretaker Prime Minister Yair Lapid said the resumption of relations will boost regional stability and business activity.

39.title: Ryan Giggs admits to lifelong infidelity, says his reputation as love cheat is justified
39.article_body: Ex-Manchester United footballer Ryan Giggs admitted to lifelong infidelity in court testimony and agreed his reputation as a "love cheat" is justified. On being asked if he was able to resist women if he was attracted to them, despite being in a relationship, he said, "No." Giggs is on trial after being accused of physically assaulting his ex-girlfriend Kate Greville.

40.title: US and China clash on Twitter over climate change
40.article_body: The US and China, the world's two biggest emitters of greenhouse gases, have clashed on Twitter on steps to mitigate climate change. Reacting to a new US climate law, China's Foreign Ministry on Tuesday tweeted, "Good to hear. But...can the US deliver?" In response, US Ambassador to China Nicholas Burns wrote, "You can bet America will meet our commitments."

41.title: NASA's Lucy mission spots Trojan asteroid around Jupiter with its own moon
41.article_body: NASA's Lucy mission has discovered that Polymele, one of the Trojan asteroids around Jupiter, has its own moon. The satellite, which is reported to be roughly 200 km away from Polymele, is 5 km in diameter. The asteroid itself is reportedly 27 km in diameter. The moon has, however, not been named as astronomers are yet to define its characteristics.

42.title: Sometimes even in a room full of people who love me, I have felt alone: Virat Kohli
42.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli, while talking about mental health in a recent interview, said, "I personally have experienced times when even in a room full of people who support and love me, I felt alone." He stated, "It is crucial to consistently keep in touch with your inner self." He further emphasised on importance of "reconnecting with core self".

43.title: Want to study Kejriwal government's education model: Bihar Minister
43.article_body: Bihar Education Minister Chandrashekhar on Wednesday said his government will send a team to Delhi and other states to study their education models. "I...feel that the existing school education system in the state must be changed. It needs a complete overhaul," Chandrashekhar said. "I have started interacting with government teachers and officials of the department," he added.

44.title: Sub-inspector dies of electrocution while washing vehicle in Nagpur
44.article_body:
A 54-year-old police sub-inspector, identified as Sahebrao Bahale, died of electrocution while washing an official vehicle using electric pump at the police headquarters in Maharashtra's Nagpur on Wednesday, an official said. Bahale was working as a driver with the local crime branch unit.
Prima facie, the electric current passed in the water, the official added.

45.title: Jaishankar shares incident from US visit when he was asked for COVID vaccine certificate
45.article_body: A video shows External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar sharing an incident from the time he and his son visited a US restaurant in 2021. "They wanted to see our COVID-19 vaccine certificate...I showed them my phone while my son produced a folded paper," Jaishankar said. "I...said 'Okay, this is where they are'," Jaishankar added while praising the CoWIN platform.

46.title: Maharashtra sees 1,800 new COVID-19 cases, a rise of more than double in 1 day
46.article_body: Maharashtra reported 1,800 fresh COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, a huge jump from the 836 cases reported the previous day. Mumbai alone reported 975 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours. Six more people, including two in Mumbai, succumbed to the infection in the state and the active cases stood at 11,370.

47.title: When I came to run for Sachin, Afridi was abusing him a lot: Sehwag on 2003 WC match
47.article_body: Recalling the 2003 World Cup match against Pakistan, former India opener Virender Sehwag said, "When I came to run for Sachin Tendulkar...Shahid Afridi was abusing him a lot, kept saying something or the other." Sehwag added, "But he remained focussed. He knew it was important for him to stay at the crease." Sachin scored 98(75) in the match.

48.title: Will benefit millions: UNICEF as it secures 1st malaria vaccine supply
48.article_body: UNICEF has awarded a contract to GSK, a pharmaceutical firm, for the first-ever supply of malaria vaccine with a value of up to $170 million. This grant will make 18 million doses of RTS,S available for next three years, potentially saving thousands of lives each year, UNICEF stated. The vaccine is a result of 35 years of research, it added.

49.title: Indian boxer Vijender Singh knocks out Ghana's Eliasu Sulley in 'The Jungle Rumble'
49.article_body: India's 2008 Olympics bronze medal-winning boxer Vijender Singh on Wednesday knocked out Ghana's Eliasu Sulley in the super middleweight main card in 'The Jungle Rumble' to register his 13th victory in pro boxing. Vijender knocked out the Ghanaian boxer in the second round. Vijender has now won nine of his pro boxing bouts by knocking out the opponent.

50.title: Jacqueline shares note as ED names her as accused in ₹200 crore extortion case
50.article_body: Jacqueline Fernandez shared a note on Instagram on Wednesday as the ED named her as an accused in the ₹200 crore extortion case involving Sukesh Chandrasekhar. "Dear me, I deserve all good things, I am powerful, I accept myself, it will all be okay. I am strong, I will achieve my goals and dreams, I can do it," it read.

51.title: Grenade launcher-equipped robot dog unveiled at Russian arms expo: Report
51.article_body: A robot dog, equipped with a rocket-propelled grenade launcher, was unveiled at Russia's Army 2022 expo on Monday, according to a video shared by news agency RIA Novosti. The dog is reportedly capable of shooting, transporting weapons and delivering medicines, supplies to front-line soldiers. The dog's frame, however, resembled that of Chinese manufacturer Unitree Robotics' consumer-grade robot.

52.title: PM, Union ministers attend screening of Doordarshan serial 'Swaraj'
52.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday attended the special screening of the Doordarshan-produced serial 'Swaraj: Bharat Ke Swatantrata Sangram Ki Samagra Gatha' at the Balayogi Auditorium in Parliament Library Building. He was accompanied by BJP National President JP Nadda and Union ministers. It is a 75-episode serial on the freedom struggle.

53.title: Family driver among 4 held for kidnapping, raping 17-yr-old in Goa
53.article_body: A 17-year-old girl was allegedly kidnapped and raped multiple times in Goa and police have arrested the family driver, along with three other men, an official said on Wednesday. "After the disappearance of the girl, her mother filed a missing person's report," said Vasco police inspector Kapil Nayak. I was raped on several occasions, the girl said in her statement.

54.title: People would come outside house to take blessings: Swwapnil on playing Krishna
54.article_body: Actor Swwapnil Joshi, who played the titular role in Ramanand Sagar's 'Shri Krishna' at the age of 15, revealed that people would gather outside his house just to catch a glimpse of him and take blessings. "I feel overwhelmed and delighted to see how people still see me as a medium between them and the divine incarnation," he added.

55.title: Ajmer-Delhi Jan Shatabdi to get extra coaches due to more rush
55.article_body: One new coach each will be added to First Class AC chair and Second Class AC chair in Ajmer-Delhi Sarai Rohilla Jan Shatabdi. The extra coaches will run from August 19 to November 30 in view of a long waiting list of railway passengers. The train leaves Ajmer Junction at 5:40 am and arrives at Delhi station at 11:35 am.

56.title: India purchasing Russian oil that has Ukrainian blood in it: Ukraine
56.article_body: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba on Wednesday said that every barrel of crude oil that India is buying from Russia at a discount has Ukrainian blood in it. Ukraine expected a "stronger practical support" from India amid the Russia-Ukraine war, he added. On Russian oil's purchase, Indian External Affairs Minister Jaishankar earlier said, "It's my…duty to…get [people] the best deal."

57.title: He's going to be here for a long time: Anupam Kher on Kartik Aaryan
57.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher recently shared a picture of himself with Kartik Aaryan. He called himself and Kartik as the "superstars" of the year because of the success of their respective films, 'The Kashmir Files' and 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. Anupam added that Kartik is going to be in the industry for a long time as "an actor and a superstar".

58.title: SL ex-Prez Rajapaksa to return to the country next week: Cousin
58.article_body: Former Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa will return to the country on August 24, his cousin Udayanga Weeratunga said on Wednesday. Rajapaksa, who fled Sri Lanka in July amid an anti-government public agitation, is presently staying in Thailand. "He talked to me on the phone, I can tell you he will return to the country next week," said Weeratunga.

59.title: Actress Gong Hyo-Jin to marry singer Kevin Oh in October: Reports
59.article_body: Korean actress Gong Hyo-jin and Korean-American singer Kevin Oh will get married in October. Gong's agency Management SOOP confirmed the news on Wednesday. "They will be holding their wedding privately in October with only their close relatives and acquaintances present," the statement read. Gong Hyo-jin and Kevin Oh confirmed their relationship in April.

60.title: Railway Minister shares video of India's 3.5-km-long train with 6 locos and 295 wagons
60.article_body: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw took to Twitter to share a video of 3.50km-long Super Vasuki loaded train, billed as the heaviest and longest freight train with six locos and 295 loaded wagons. South East Central Railway operated the train on August 15 as part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' celebrations. It was run from Korba in Chhattisgarh to Rajnandgaon.

61.title: Don't make me the mother of 30 & 40-year-olds: Shefali Shah to filmmakers
61.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah, who recently portrayed the role of Alia Bhatt's mother in 'Darlings', has requested the filmmakers not to approach her with the role of a mother. "Don't come to me with stuff because you've run out of imagination of who to cast as a mother," she said. "Don't make me the mother of...40...and...30-year-old because I'm not," Shefali added.

62.title: Man shares how TTE helped him while travelling with baby, Railway Ministry replies
62.article_body: A man has shared how a travelling ticket examiner (TTE) shifted him to a well-lit seat as he was travelling with a baby. "Travelling with a 1y old baby on train 12601 (B1 Coach) boarding at Kannur, the TTE...[gave]...us his well-lit seat," he wrote. "We hope...you and the toddler had a comfortable journey...We're always at your service," Railway Ministry replied.

63.title: CBI freezes ₹16.97 crore FDs belonging to TMC leader Mondal, family
63.article_body: The CBI on Wednesday froze ₹16.97 crore worth of fixed deposits (FDs) belonging to Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Anubrata Mondal and his family members. Meanwhile, CBI officers visited his residence in Bolpur to question his daughter on Wednesday. However, Sukanya Mondal refused to talk to them. Anubrata Mondal was arrested last Thursday in connection with a cross-border cattle smuggling case.

64.title: I don’t know why they are doing this: Anjali Arora on obscene video leak
64.article_body: Reacting to the obscene video being circulated in her name, Instagram influencer Anjali Arora said, "I don't know why they are doing this." Adding that the video first surfaced when she was still contesting in reality show 'Lock Upp', Anjali said her family had lodged complaints regarding the video. "Those who can't reach your level start defaming you," she said.

65.title: Raj Cong setting 'new records' in crimes against women, Dalits: Shekhawat
65.article_body: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Wednesday criticised the Congress saying its government in Rajasthan was setting "new records" in crimes against women and atrocities against Dalits. Citing the National Crime Records Bureau data, Shekhawat said, "Today, Rajasthan is at number one in the cases of rape in the country, second in terms of trafficking of minor girls."

66.title: Punjab Vigilance Bureau arrests lineman for accepting ₹10,000 bribe
66.article_body: The Punjab Vigilance Bureau on Wednesday arrested lineman Krishan Kumar, posted in Punjab State Power Corporation Limited (PSPCL) in Patiala district, while accepting a bribe of ₹10,000. The complainant alleged that Krishan Kumar had already taken ₹3,000 as a bribe for the installation of a domestic electricity meter at his plot, spokesperson of Vigilance Bureau said.

67.title: 50-yr-old man trampled to death by elephant in Chhattisgarh's Korba
67.article_body: A 50-year-old man, identified as Shamlal Singh, was trampled to death by an elephant in Chhattisgarh's Korba district on Wednesday, officials said. "Singh and other villagers were trying to chase the elephant away but it suddenly charged towards them. In a bid to save himself, Singh fell and the jumbo trampled him to death," Forest Range Officer Dharmendra Chouhan said.

68.title: Hope she gets out of trouble: Madhavan backs Jacqueline in extortion case
68.article_body: Backing actress Jacqueline Fernandez, who was accused by ED in ₹200 core extortion case, involving conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar, R Madhavan said, "I hope she gets out of trouble very soon." "I don't think this is affecting the image of the country. In fact, in our film fraternity, there have been lesser...tax raids. Everyone is working with full honesty," he added.

69.title: My film was a biopic: Madhavan on why 'Rocketry' didn't fail like 'Laal...'
69.article_body: Sharing why 'Laal Singh Chaddha' failed at the box office while 'Rocketry' succeeded, actor R Madhavan said, "The difference with my film was that I made a biopic, so it is not time agnostic, it would have worked in any time." He added, "If we knew (why 'Laal...' didn't work), we would all be making hit films," he added.

70.title: Pics of Mike Tyson in wheelchair go viral, spark health concerns
70.article_body: American boxing legend Mike Tyson was spotted in a wheelchair at the Miami International Airport. The pictures went viral on social media, sparking health concerns of the 56-year-old. Earlier, he was also seen requiring a walking stick while in New York. He has reportedly been suffering with a sciatica flare-up.

71.title: It’s hard: Bob Odenkirk on bidding goodbye to 'Better Call Saul'
71.article_body: 'Better Call Saul' actor Bob Odenkirk called the show "an unbelievable experience". He said "it is hard" for him to say goodbye to the show and his character Saul Goodman. He thanked the audience for giving the show a chance, which he said could have been "hated" as it was the spinoff of one of the popular shows, 'Breaking Bad'.

72.title: India supplies 60% of vaccines used worldwide: Nirmala Sitharaman
72.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said India produces and supplies 60% of the vaccines that are used worldwide. Launching the book 'India's Vaccine Growth Story' by Sajjan Singh Yadav, Additional Secretary, Expenditure Department, Sitharaman added that India has made remarkable contribution in vaccinating the world. She also praised India for producing COVID-19 vaccines even in the lockdown.

73.title: Sachin knows everything, I'm not expecting anything from him: Kambli on financial crunch
73.article_body: Former India cricketer Vinod Kambli, in a recent interview, said that he is in need of money as he has a family to look after. He added that his only source of income is the ₹30,000 pension he gets via BCCI. Kambli added that Sachin Tendulkar knows everything but he is not expecting anything from him.

74.title: Man gets life term for abducting, raping 8-yr-old girl in UP
74.article_body: A local court in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj sentenced a man, Vicky Kahar, to life imprisonment for abducting and raping an eight-year-old girl. The court also imposed a fine of ₹50,000 on him. Kahar abducted the girl on May 7, 2020 and later raped her, counsel for the prosecution Vinod Singh said on Tuesday.

75.title: 1 Kanwariya killed, 25 others injured after bus hits divider in Bihar
75.article_body: One Kanwariya was killed and 25 others were injured when a bus travelling from Deoghar to Kishanganj hit the divider on NH-31 about 15 kilometres from Bihar's Purnea district headquarters on Wednesday. Some of the Kanwariyas received major injuries and they were sent to government medical college and hospital, Purnea, SHO Dagarua Ramchandra Mandal said.

76.title: 'Uber refunded excess amount citing GPS error,' says man who was charged ₹3,000 for 45 km
76.article_body: A Noida resident, who had claimed that Uber charged him ₹2,935 for a 45-km ride, has said the excess amount was refunded to his account on Tuesday night. "The problem was assigned to a 'GPS error'. But I'm sorry this corrective measure came after going public and not following up through your assigned customer support mechanism," he added.

77.title: Rohingyas cannot settle here, Delhi's residents won't let that happen: AAP
77.article_body: AAP Chief Spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj on Wednesday said Rohingyas cannot settle in Delhi and Delhi's residents won't let the Centre allot EWS flats to them. "[Housing Rohingyas] is a threat to security of Indians, of the residents of Delhi," Bharadwaj added. "BJP-led Centre wants to provide housing to Rohingyas and use them for their benefit," he further said.

78.title: Rusk Media raises $9.5 million in Series A funding round
78.article_body: Digital entertainment startup Rusk Media has raised $9.5 million in the extension of its Series A funding round. The extension round was led by Seoul based DAOL Investment and Audacity Ventures and also saw participation from existing investors InfoEdge Ventures (IEV), Mistry Ventures and Survam Partners. The company is looking to launch a UGC-led social gaming platform, soon.

79.title: SRK's 'Dunki' to also be shot in Punjab and Dubai: Reports
79.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan will reportedly shoot the remaining portions of his upcoming film 'Dunki' in Mumbai, Punjab and Dubai. Earlier, he shot for the film in London and Budapest. As per reports, Rajkumar Hirani is preparing for the upcoming schedules and has already begun working on the post-production. He is yet to decide when they will resume the shoot.

80.title: Women won't feel safe by PM Modi’s empty words on empowerment: Cong
80.article_body: Women will not feel safe by PM Narendra Modi's "empty words" on their empowerment, Congress leader Amee Yajnik said on Wednesday. Her remarks came following the release of 11 life-term convicts in the 2002 Bilkis Bano case. It (the release of convicts) shows a difference in PM's words and deeds, she said. The convicts were received with sweets, Yajnik alleged.

81.title: 3 CISF commandos dismissed after security breach at NSA Doval's home
81.article_body: Months after a security breach at National Security Advisor Ajit Doval's residence, three CISF commandos have been dismissed from service. Also, two senior officers of its VIP security unit have been transferred. The incident took place in February when a man from Bengaluru tried to drive his car into Doval's house in central Delhi.

82.title: Zomato-backed Shiprocket becomes India's 21st unicorn of 2022
82.article_body: Zomato-backed logistics startup Shiprocket has raised ₹259 crore in an extended Series E round at a post-money valuation of ₹9,815 crore (around $1.2 billion), according to company filings with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA). With this, it has become the country's 21st unicorn of 2022. Shiprocket was established in 2017.

83.title: WB HC grants interim bail to 3 Jharkhand MLAs in cash seizure case
83.article_body: West Bengal's Calcutta High Court on Wednesday granted interim bail to Jharkhand MLAs Irfan Ansari, Rajesh Kachhap and Naman Bixal. The now-suspended Congress MLA were arrested in July while carrying ₹49 lakh in cash in a car in Howrah. The high court has directed the MLAs to not leave Kolkata and also provide a bond of ₹1 lakh each.

84.title: Instead of housing Rohingyas, push them out of Bharat: VHP to Centre
84.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) Working President Alok Kumar on Wednesday urged the Centre to "push [Rohingyas] out of Bharat" instead of housing them in Delhi's Bakkarwala. "'Rohingyas are not refugees but the infiltrators' has been the consistent stand of the [Centre]," Kumar said. Kumar also referred to Home Minister Amit Shah's statement saying, "Rohingyas will never be accepted in India."

85.title: 48 killed in 2022 so far due to footpath encroachment in Pune: Report
85.article_body: As many as 48 pedestrians were killed between January-June this year due to encroachment of footpaths in Pune, according to information obtained by NGO Save Pune Traffic Movement under the RTI Act. According to its analysis, there were 84 pedestrian fatalities in 2021. "The survey findings will be deliberated...An appropriate action plan will be readied," DCP (traffic) Rahul Shrirame said.

86.title: Bengaluru's Namma Metro records highest one-day ridership on I-Day
86.article_body: Bengaluru's Namma Metro registered its highest-ever one-day ridership on Independence Day (Monday) with a footfall of 8.25 lakh, metro officials said. "The flower show at Lalbagh, the 'freedom march' at National College ground...contributed to the highest-ever ridership," an official said. On August 15, the metro corporation ran nearly 170 trips as compared to 135 trips it makes on regular days.

87.title: Bharti Airtel to borrow ₹3,000 cr to make initial payment for 5G airwaves: Report
87.article_body: Bharti Airtel is set to raise ₹3,000 crore in short-term debt to make the initial payment for the 5G airwaves it bought in the recently concluded auction, according to reports. Commercial papers, with maturities up to 12 months, are reportedly being sold by Airtel. SBI Mutual Fund is believed to have agreed to buy over ₹1,000 crore of Airtel's debt.

88.title: Alphabet invested $1.5 bn in blockchain firms from Sept 2021-Jun 2022: Report
88.article_body: Google-parent Alphabet invested $1.5 billion in blockchain sector between September 2021 and June 2022, Cointelegraph reported. Alphabet has reportedly invested in digital asset custody platform Fireblocks, Web3.0 gaming firm Dapper Labs, Bitcoin infrastructure tool Voltage and venture capital firm Digital Currency Group. Last year, Google had invested $601.4 million in 17 blockchain-based firms.

89.title: Bhim Army chief detained on his way to meet family of Dalit boy killed in Rajasthan
89.article_body: Bhim Army chief Chandra Shekhar Aazad was detained in Rajasthan's Jodhpur airport on Wednesday when he was going to meet the family of the nine-year-old Dalit boy who was allegedly beaten to death by his teacher. He was beaten up for allegedly touching a water pot in the Jalore district. The boy had suffered injuries to his eye and ear.

90.title: Airlines asked to take strict action against mask violators amid rising COVID-19 cases
90.article_body: In view of rising number of COVID-19 cases, the DGCA on Wednesday advised airlines to ensure that passengers are wearing face masks properly throughout the journey. "In case a passenger does not comply with the directions, strict action will be taken by airlines," it said. Airlines would also have to ensure there is proper sensitisation of passengers through various platforms.

91.title: House of Kashmiri Pandit killing-suspect attached; his father, brothers held
91.article_body: The house of a terrorist, believed to have killed a Kashmiri Pandit in J&K's Shopian on Tuesday, was attached and his father and three brothers were arrested for sheltering him. Police said Adil Wani killed SK Bhat, a fruit farmer, in an orchard in Shopian and later took shelter at his home. Bhat's brother was also injured in the attack.

92.title: BJP has jaundice, they propagate lies: Siddaramaiah on Shivamogga clashes
92.article_body: Taking a jibe at BJP after the clashes in Karnataka's Shivamogga, Congress leader Siddaramaiah said that the party has "jaundice" and they "propagate lies". BJP opted to put VD Savarkar's portrait in a Muslim area and removed Tipu Sultan's, he said. "BJP is doing double standard politics." Siddaramaiah further added.

93.title: Don’t mislead people: HC to Baba Ramdev over COVID-19 vaccine remark
93.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Wednesday questioned Baba Ramdev for his COVID-19 vaccine remark and said that he shouldn't mislead people by saying more than what is official. Ramdev had said that US President testing positive for COVID-19 despite being vaccinated is a "failure" of medical science. Naming leaders will affect our relations with countries, said Justice Anup Jairam Bhambhani.

94.title: Ola driver, dancer offer Mumbai man job of male escort, try to extort ₹5 lakh
94.article_body: Three men, including an Ola driver and dancer, have been arrested for allegedly trying to extort ₹5 lakh from a Mumbai man, after offering him the job of a male escort, the Oshiwara Police said. A woman will pay ₹20,000 for a male escort and you'd get half of it if you accept the offer, the accused told the victim.

95.title: B'luru Police arrest man who killed his wife, filed missing complaint
95.article_body: Bengaluru Police arrested a 30-year-old man for allegedly killing his wife, dumping her body while returning from Udupi and later filing a missing report, police said on Wednesday. The accused told the police that he had hatched a plan to kill his wife, suspecting her of having an affair with a man she had met a few years back.

96.title: AI-based e-commerce startup Graas raised $40 mn in funding
96.article_body: Singapore-based e-commerce solutions provider Graas (growth-as-a-service) raised $40 million as part of its ongoing Series A funding round. The round was led by a Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) called Galaxy, Performa, Integra Partners, Xander Group-backed Yuj Ventures and AJ Capital. Part of the capital was used to acquire Pune-based Shoptimize and SELLinALL, a Southeast Asia marketplace expert.

97.title: 'Baba ka Bulldozer' posters featuring UP CM seen at I-Day rally in US
97.article_body: A bulldozer decorated with 'Baba ka Bulldozer' posters featuring Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath was spotted at a rally celebrating Indian Independence Day in New Jersey, America. Pictures of Prime Minister Narendra Modi were also seen on the bulldozer. Visuals of the bulldozer have gone viral. This comes amid the use of bulldozers by UP administration to demolish unauthorised buildings.

98.title: Centre grants 'Z' category VIP security cover to Gautam Adani: Reports
98.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani has been accorded a 'Z' category VIP security cover of CRPF commandos by the central government, reports said. The all-India cover will reportedly be on a "payment basis" and is expected to cost about ₹15-20 lakh/month. The cover was given on the basis of a threat perception report prepared by central security agencies, reports added.

99.title: Gulzar to turn his poems 'Samandar', 'Baarish', among others to NFTs
99.article_body: Legendary poet and lyricist Gulzar has collaborated with Kulturemint to turn his timeless poems into NFTs. Some of his iconic pieces like 'Samandar', 'Lal Haveli', 'Baarish' and 'One-Sided Love' are going to be digitally immortalized into NFTs as part of this partnership. "I am very happy to give my poems to Kulturemint for turning them into NFTs," Gulzar said.

100.title: He might: Mikkelsen on whether Depp will return to 'Fantastic Beasts' franchise
100.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp, who was replaced by Mads Mikkelsen in the 'Fantastic Beasts' franchise, "might" return to the 'Harry Potter' spinoff series. Mads has hinted about his possible comeback after he won the defamation suit against ex-wife Amber Heard. "Let's see if he comes back. He might," Mads said. Depp was replaced after Heard's domestic violence accusations.

101.title: Sona Comstar partners with Israel-based DRIVE TLV
101.article_body: Automotive technology company Sona Comstar has partnered with Israeli startup DRIVE TLV to focus on new technologies in the smart mobility sector. Under the partnership, Sona Comstar will have access to Israel's high-tech mobility startup ecosystem. Kiran M Deshmukh, Group CTO at Sona Comstar said that the partnership with will speed up the innovation process.

102.title: German Chancellor condemns Palestinian leader's Holocaust comment
102.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Wednesday said he was "disgusted by the outrageous remarks" of Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas wherein he accused Israel of committing "50 Holocausts". Abbas made the comments as he refused to condemn the attack at 1972 Munich Olympics. "For us...the Holocaust is intolerable...I condemn any attempt to deny the crimes of the Holocaust," Scholz said.

103.title: Gokulam Kerala write to PM after women footballers get stranded in Tashkent post FIFA ban
103.article_body: With AIFF being suspended by FIFA, Gokulam Kerala football club's women's team members are currently stranded in Uzbekistan's Tashkent and won't be allowed to participate in AFC Women's Club Championship. The club wrote to PM Narendra Modi, seeking intervention. "We've been declared ineligible for no fault of ours," it said, adding that players trained for 60 days to prepare.

104.title: 17 locations in southern Thailand hit by bombings, arson attacks; 7 hurt
104.article_body: At least 17 locations in southern Thailand were hit by bombings and arson attacks, leaving seven persons injured, officials said on Wednesday. The attacks, which took place on the intervening night of Tuesday and Wednesday, targeted convenience stores and a gas station. The coordinated attacks happened in Pattani, Narathiwat and Yala provinces, military official Pramote Promin said.

105.title: Making all efforts to meet your expectations: Mohanlal on 'Lucifer 2'
105.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Prithviraj announced that the team of 'Lucifer 2' is starting the pre-production work on the film. He said the success of 'Lucifer' has enabled the makers to dream big for its sequel, which is titled 'Empuraan'. Actor Mohanlal said 'Empuraan' will be shot in different countries. He said the team is "making all the efforts" to meet fans' expectations.

106.title: Didn't lose my house for Rocketry, will proudly pay heavy Income Tax: Madhavan on claims
106.article_body: Reacting to viral claims on social media that he lost his house to fund 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect', R Madhavan said, "Please don't over patronise my sacrifice. I didn't lose my house or anything." He added, "In fact...all involved in Rocketry will be very proudly paying heavy Income Tax this year. God's grace...We all made very good and proud profits."

107.title: Intl Finance Corp backs blockchain-enabled platform to trade carbon offsets
107.article_body: World Bank affiliate International Finance Corporation (IFC) on Wednesday said it's backing a blockchain-enabled platform to trade carbon offsets, aiming to attract more support from international investors for climate-friendly projects. The Carbon Opportunities Fund has received $10 million in seed money. IFC would only source, tokenise and sell unused credits from an established registry.

108.title: 'Jihadi mindset': BJP on Siddaramaiah's 'Muslim area' remark
108.article_body: BJP leaders took a jibe at Congress leader Siddaramaiah for his statement asking, "Why put Savarkar's photo in a Muslim area?" and termed it a "Jihadi mindset". "By periodically displaying a 'Jihadi mindset' you are proving to be more dangerous than the Jihadis who kill innocents," BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi said.

109.title: People are not able to see me outside the garb of a woman: Ali Asgar
109.article_body: Ali Asgar said he feels typecast as an actor and stated, "My image as...comedian is so strong that...people don't consider me for any other role." "They are not able to see me outside the garb of a woman," he added. Talking about his exit from 'The Kapil Sharma Show', Ali said, "I wasn't creatively satisfied, as my character wasn't growing."

110.title: Hyderabad Police warn citizens about rise in cybercrimes
110.article_body: The Hyderabad Police warned citizens about rise in cybercrime cases by organised gangs who are convincing people to rent their bank accounts in exchange for money. The warning comes after the bank account of a woman from Maharashtra was used for cheating several people for online investments. The police said that the targets are usually unemployed and low salaried people.

111.title: It's my dream story: Puri Jagannadh on Vijay Deverakonda's 'JGM'
111.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh shared that his next film 'JGM: Jana Gana Mana' is his "dream story", which he wrote almost a decade back. He shared, "It's a very big film and we have got international technicians on board. We are planning a big schedule in Morocco next month." 'JGM' marks Puri and Vijay Deverakonda's second collaboration after 'Liger'.

112.title: 31-yr-old techie found dead in Hyderabad flat under mysterious circumstances
112.article_body: A 31-year-old software engineer was found dead in his Hyderabad apartment under mysterious circumstances, police said on Wednesday. The deceased was identified as Y Bhargava Reddy, a native of Andhra Pradesh's Krishna district, who was staying with friends, Sai Sandeep and Jaswant, police said. On Tuesday, when Sandeep returned to Hyderabad, he found Reddy lying dead in his bedroom.

113.title: India-made SSI Mantra's 5 robotic arms to benefit underserved: Study
113.article_body: London-based GlobalData said that India-made multi-arm novel tele robotic assistance (Mantra) surgical robotic system will help provide cost-effective robotic surgical treatment for underserved population globally. The system was recently launched by India-based startup SS Innovations. According to the report, India's robotic surgical systems market is likely to reach 45 million in value in 2030.

114.title: BJP will create history again, touch 350 seats in 2024 polls: Shekhawat
114.article_body: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Wednesday said BJP will create history again in the upcoming 2024 Lok Sabha elections and win over 350 seats. "The way popularity of PM Narendra Modi is increasing continuously in the country, it's evident that people want him to win again," Shekhawat said. "In Bihar, we've set a target of 35 seats," he added.

115.title: Protests break out in Kerala as student dresses up as Savarkar for I-Day parade
115.article_body: Protests broke out in a school in Kerala's Malappuram district amid Independence Day celebrations, after a school student dressed up as VD Savarkar for a procession. The students had dressed up as freedom fighters, but the aforementioned student dressed up as Savarkar, despite his name not being listed as a freedom fighter.

116.title: It's 'inevitable': Ponting on Boult giving up his NZ central contract
116.article_body: Reacting to New Zealand pacer Trent Boult giving up his central contract, Ricky Ponting said, "It's inevitable...We'll...hear more about this in the coming years." "For someone like Trent Boult, and no disrespect to New Zealand at all, but I'm sure their national contracts are...only reflective of maybe what he'd make in one of these T20 domestic tournaments," added Ponting.

117.title: Cricketing leagues should be taken forward 'carefully': Ashwin
117.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin said the future of international cricket will be "largely affected" by franchise cricket. "The IPL window has also been extended," added Ashwin. "We should take the leagues forward carefully," he stated. Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting stated it's getting "harder & harder" to maintain the full schedule of international cricket, with the emergence of T20 domestic tournaments.

118.title: SRH name their new CSA T20 League franchise 'Sunrisers Eastern Cape'
118.article_body: The Sunrisers Hyderabad have announced the name of their South African franchise for the CSA T20 League to be "Sunrisers Eastern Cape". Notably, all six participating teams at the CSA T20 League have been acquired by IPL franchise owners. Sunrisers Eastern Cape have also named South Africa batter Aiden Markram and pacer Ottniel Baartman as their first two signings.

119.title: Gold trades flat ahead of release of Fed's policy meeting minutes
119.article_body: Gold prices in India were trading flat to negative on Wednesday even as they traded flat globally ahead of the release of the minutes of US Federal Reserve's latest policy meeting. Gold October futures were trading at ₹51,807 per 10 gram on the Multi Commodity Exchange. Spot gold was flat at $1,775.59/ounce, while US gold futures were steady at $1,788.80/ounce.

120.title: Bihar developments will have zero impact on UP polls: Keshav Maurya
120.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said the political developments in Bihar will have "zero" impact on the 2024 general elections in UP. By joining hands with RJD and Congress, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has positioned himself in a difficult situation, Maurya said. He further asserted that SP and Congress will lose their strongholds in the 2024 UP elections.

121.title: Madras HC grants 'no caste, no religion' certificate to 3-yr-old in Chennai
121.article_body: Madras HC has directed authorities to issue a 'no caste, no religion' certificate to a three-year-old boy in Chennai. The boy was denied admission to a school after his parents denied to mention their caste or community. His father then filed the petition. Tamil Nadu government's earlier orders mandate schools to not insist parents to mention their caste or community.

122.title: SBI branch in Pune vacated after fan in basement catches fire
122.article_body: The premises of a State Bank of India (SBI) branch in Pune's Karve Road was vacated after a fan in the basement locker room caught fire on Wednesday morning. No casualties or loss of property, other than the fan, were reported. A fire station officer said, "Intense smoke was coming from...basement...Firefighters controlled the fire...[in] less than half an hour."

123.title: After minister's tweet, Centre clarifies 'No orders to provide flats to Rohingyas in Delhi'
123.article_body: Centre has clarified it hasn't given directions to provide EWS flats to illegal Rohingya migrants in Delhi. This comes after Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri tweeted, "In a landmark decision, all Rohingya refugees will be shifted to EWS flats in Bakkarwala area of Delhi." Centre asked Delhi government to ensure Rohingyas are kept at their present location for their deportation.

124.title: Shefali Shah tests positive for COVID-19
124.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has tested positive for COVID-19. In a note, which she shared on Instagram, Shefali said she has isolated herself and will be under home quarantine. She said she is following all the safety protocols as instructed by her doctor. "Requesting everyone who came in contact with me to get tested immediately too," she wrote.

125.title: India's fixtures for next 2 World Test Championships released
125.article_body: ICC today released fixtures for next two World Test Championships. In the 2023-25 cycle, India will host New Zealand, England and Bangladesh, while India's away series will be against Australia, West Indies and South Africa. In the 2025-27 cycle, India will host Australia, West Indies and South Africa and play their overseas series against New Zealand, England and Sri Lanka.

126.title: Modi ko hatana hai: Lalu vows to oust 'dictatorial' govt in 2024 LS polls
126.article_body: RJD leader Lalu Prasad Yadav on Wednesday took a jibe at the BJP-led Central government and said, "Hatana hai, Modi ko hatana hai". "We have to oust the dictatorial government," Yadav said, when asked about the 2024 LS polls. "Sushil Modi is a liar," Yadav said, when asked about Modi's statements about the formation of a new government in Bihar.

127.title: Only concern is Virat hasn't played too many T20Is: Rajkumar on Asia Cup
127.article_body: Talking about the upcoming Asia Cup, Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma has said there's a "slight concern" that Kohli hasn't played too many T20Is this year. Rajkumar, however, also added that Kohli is coming back "refreshed" following his break after the England tour. Kohli has only played four T20Is in 2022 so far.

128.title: Expect Patna HC to take serious notice: RS Prasad on Bihar minister facing arrest
128.article_body: BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad commented on Bihar Law Minister Kartikeya Singh’s allegedly outstanding arrest warrant on Wednesday. "We expect Patna HC to take serious notice of this. I expect CM Nitish Kumar to show some courage," Prasad said. "Kartikeya Singh should be sacked and strict action should be taken against him," he added.

129.title: Flipkart fined ₹1 lakh for sale of substandard pressure cookers
129.article_body: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has imposed a penalty of ₹1,00,000 on Flipkart for allowing the sale of substandard domestic pressure cookers on its platform. The e-commerce platform has been asked to inform consumers of the 598 pressure cookers sold on its platform, recall the pressure cookers and reimburse money to the consumers, CCPA Chief Commissioner Nidhi Khare said.

130.title: Bengaluru's Sir CV Raman Road to be closed for a month
130.article_body: Sir CV Raman Road in north Bengaluru will be closed for traffic for 30 days as white topping (concrete layering) work will be done on it, police said. Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will start the concrete layering work on Thursday. Traffic diversions have been put in place using the stretch from BHEL Circle to Yeshwanthpur Circle.

131.title: FPI stock holding drops 14% to $523 bn in June quarter: Report
131.article_body: The value of the foreign portfolio investors (FPI) holdings in Indian equities dropped 14% to $523 billion in the quarter ended June as against $612 billion in the previous quarter, according to a Morningstar report. The value of FPIs' investments in Indian equities has declined for three consecutive quarters. US Federal Reserve's aggressive stance dented the sentiments of foreign investors.

132.title: Fly down from London every weekend: Janhvi on craziest thing done by a boy
132.article_body: Talking about the "craziest" thing done for her by a boy, during an interview, actress Janhvi Kapoor said he would fly down from London "every weekend" to see her. "I've broken up...because he didn't order me a chicken salad," Janhvi had shared about her previous relationships. Discussing her "strange" habits, Janhvi stated she needs to eat ice-cream every two hours.

133.title: upGrad appoints Myleeta Aga Williams as CEO for international ops
133.article_body: Mumbai-based edtech unicorn upGrad has appointed Myleeta Aga Williams as the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) for its international business. Aga Williams will be spearheading operations across the Asia-Pacific, Middle East, Africa, Europe and the United States regions. Earlier, she managed diverse portfolios and led marketing and sales teams at Netflix, BBC Studios, Discovery and UTV.

134.title: One dead, 11 injured as neighbours clash over parking in UP's Bhadohi
134.article_body: One person died and 11 others were injured after an argument over parking a motorcycle in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi district turned violent, police said. The incident occurred on Tuesday when one faction parked motorcycle in front of the door of another. Twelve people belonging to both sides were injured, following which they were rushed to the district hospital, police added.

135.title: Retail sales continue to surpass pre-COVID levels, up 18% in July: RAI
135.article_body: Retail businesses across India registered an 18% growth in July sales as against the corresponding period in 2019, the Retailers Association of India (RAI) said on Wednesday. The growth is above the pre-pandemic levels. With 25%, the east India region saw the highest year-on-year growth, followed by the south at 21%, north at 16% and west at 10%, RAI said.

136.title: Shows on OTT don’t drag: Aly Goni on why he prefers OTT over TV
136.article_body: Actor Aly Goni opened up about why he loves to work more on OTT than TV and said, "shows on OTT don't drag". "They get over in...two or three months...you get time to be around your close ones," he stated. "[In] TV, you work many hours non-stop, but in OTT in a day, you shoot limited scenes," Aly added.

137.title: Don't see that 'at all': Reetinder on Kohli, Rohit opening in Asia Cup
137.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi said he doesn't see Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma opening in the Asia Cup "at all". "Kohli's best at number three...The talk is about positive intent...not...changing your game," added Reetinder. Discussing Team India's aggressive approach, Reetinder stated, "The...template is never that Kohli needs to hit a six off the first ball for India to score 200."

138.title: Stand up now and speak, Man Utd is in crisis: Ex-teammate Neville to Cristiano
138.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo's former teammate from Manchester United Gary Neville has asked the Portuguese forward to "stand up and speak" as the club is in "crisis". Ronaldo had recently said he'll reveal the truth about his situation "in a couple of weeks". "Why does the greatest player of all time have to wait two weeks to tell the truth?" asked Neville.

139.title: SBI opens 1st dedicated branch for startups in Bengaluru
139.article_body: State Bank of India opened its first-ever startup-dedicated branch in Bengaluru, which will offer services like funding, investment banking and treasury operations. The startup branch is located in Koramangala. The branch comes under a pact between the Karnataka government and SBI to further boost the state's startup ecosystem.

140.title: Ujjivan Small Finance Bank hikes interest rate on fixed deposits
140.article_body: Ujjivan Small Finance Bank has increased the interest rate on fixed deposits by up to 1.5% with effect from August 9, 2022. The bank has raised the rate by 0.3-1.50% across different tenures on the occasion of the 75 years of India's Independence. It also introduced tenures of 75 weeks (525 days) and 75 months with 7.5% rate per annum.

141.title: Journalist Rana Ayyub moves Delhi HC against attachment of funds by ED
141.article_body: Journalist Rana Ayyub has moved the Delhi High Court against the attachment of her funds by Enforcement Directorate (ED). "Provisional attachment has expired after 180 days yet PMLA provisions (Adjudicating Authority) is continuing with proceedings", her plea stated. ED had provisionally attached her assets worth ₹1.77 crore. Ayyub is being investigated by ED in an alleged money laundering case.

142.title: Murder accused stabs woman head constable to evade arrest in B'luru
142.article_body: A 20-year-old murder accused allegedly stabbed a 45-year-old woman head constable to evade arrest in Bengaluru. The accused was out on bail and had skipped court, prompting the police to look for him. During the inquiry, officers learned the accused was planning a murder and he attacked the woman constable when the police attempted to arrest him.

143.title: Asian LNG price surges to its highest in 5 months amid fuel crunch
143.article_body: Asian prices of the spot liquefied natural gas (LNG) surged close to $60 per million British thermal units on Tuesday, its highest in five months. With Russia cutting gas supplies to Europe amid the war with Ukraine, Asian and European utilities are increasing efforts to secure LNG spot cargoes ahead of the winters when consumption is at its peak.

144.title: Bumrah shares pic with Harshal after being ruled out of Asia Cup
144.article_body: Team India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has shared a picture with pacer Harshal Patel. Both the pacers have been ruled out of the upcoming Asia Cup and are reportedly undergoing rehabilitation at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru. India have named only three pacers, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Arshdeep Singh and Avesh Khan, in the 15-member squad for the Asia Cup.

145.title: ₹1.3 crore in Bitcoin extorted from businessman in Lucknow; 3 arrested
145.article_body: Police arrested three people in Uttar Pradesh for allegedly kidnapping and extorting ₹1.3 crore in Bitcoin from a businessman in Lucknow. The accused had taken the victim to Barabanki under the pretext of showing him a plot of land. The victim was then taken to a house, held hostage and tortured till he revealed his password and transferred the amount.

146.title: Skye Air, Flipkart Health to deliver medicines through drones in Kolkata
146.article_body: Drones startup Skye Air has partnered with Flipkart Health to deliver medicines through drones in Kolkata. Under this pilot programme, there will be 20 flights everyday, each carrying a load of 5 kilograms, from the warehouse to 10 different locations. The flight will cover an aerial distance of 16 kilometres and optimal flight safety will be ensured, Flipkart Health said.

147.title: 40-yr-old woman killed after getting hit by Delhi Fire Service truck
147.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was killed after being hit by a Delhi Fire Service truck, which was on its way back after attending a fire call on Wednesday morning in Delhi's Raj Park, police said. The incident took place when the deceased was going to work, police said. DCP (outer) Sameer Sharma said that she was lying under the rear tyre.

148.title: 1.4 kg ivory carving worth ₹2.5 cr seized in Thane, 2 arrested
148.article_body: Police seized an ivory carving worth ₹2.50 crore from Thane and arrested two persons on the charge of smuggling elephant tusks, an official said on Wednesday. Crime unit-I of the city police seized the ivory piece weighing 1.4 kg from Kalwa on Tuesday. "An image of a woman along with some design was carved on the tusk," the official added.

149.title: No directions given to provide flats to Rohingya illegal migrants in Delhi: Centre
149.article_body: The Centre has clarified it has not given any directions to provide EWS flats to Rohingya illegal migrants in Delhi. The Centre added that Delhi government had proposed to shift Rohingyas to a new location, but it asked Delhi government to ensure they are kept at their present location as the MHA has taken up the matter of their deportation.

150.title: Apple may fire a worker over her video on security advice for iPhones: Reports
150.article_body: Apple has reportedly threatened to fire an employee who posted a TikTok video identifying herself as its employee and giving viewers security advice regarding their iPhones. She had posted a video as a response to a user who had lost her iPhone and received threatening messages over data leak. Her video generated over 5 million views in just 24 hours.

151.title: Situation in Sri Lanka stabilised, no need to extend emergency: Prez
151.article_body: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe said the country will not extend a state of emergency imposed to control anti-government protests, adding the situation has "stabilised". The emergency, which was imposed by Wickremesinghe after ex-President Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled Sri Lanka in mid-July, is due to lapse on Thursday. However, Wickremesinghe has the power to renew it every month thereafter.

152.title: Observed how H'wood brings storytelling alive: Ayan on 'Brahmastra'
152.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji, speaking about his inspiration behind 'Brahmastra', has said that he observed closely "how Hollywood was regularly using technology to bring their storytelling alive as blockbuster cinema". He added that he was "deeply affected" by the stories his father used to tell about Hindu Gods and Goddesses. Ayan stated he's proud that 'Brahmastra' is a very original film.

153.title: Declare Basti, eastern UP as drought-hit: BJP MP in letter to CM Yogi
153.article_body: BJP MP Harish Dwivedi has asked UP CM Yogi Adityanath to declare Basti and eastern UP as drought-hit amid deficit rainfall. In a letter, Dwivedi said farmers were under stress because they haven't been able to sow paddy due to the weather conditions. Earlier, a BJP MLA made a similar request for Shahjahanpur district, asking government to launch relief operations.

154.title: Hyderabad airport to use DigiYatra platform for hassle-free travel
154.article_body: The DigiYatra platform will be rolled out at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport from August 18 for three months, the GMR Hyderabad International Airport said. The platform facilitates paperless travel by using facial recognition at two checkpoints for seamless and hassle-free travel. The checkpoints will be at the Departure Domestic Entry Gate 3 and at the Security Hold Area (SHA).

155.title: 55-yr-old cyclist crushed under truck while dodging potholes in Thane
155.article_body: A 55-year-old cyclist, identified as Sayeed Abdul Pathan, was allegedly crushed under the rear wheels of a container while trying to dodge potholes on Thane's Wada Bhiwandi Road. The incident took place on Tuesday, when Sayeed was on his way to the market, riding towards Wada Taluka. Eyewitnesses said Sayeed fell on the right side while failing to dodge potholes.

156.title: Why nobody raises voice when Kings of B'wood boycott outsiders: Vivek Agnihotri
156.article_body: Director Vivek Agnihotri took to Twitter to speak about 'Hinduphobia' and boycott culture in Bollywood and said, "Why nobody from Bollywood raises voice when the Kings of Bollywood boycott, ban and destroy careers of so many outsider actors, directors, writers?" He added, "The day...Indians get to know the...fascism and Hinduphobia of...dons of Bollywood, they'll drown them in hot coffee."

157.title: I get along with women more than men: Anurag on directing women-led films
157.article_body: Anurag Kashyap, speaking about directing women-led films, has said that he gets along with women more than men. "Women are easier to work with...Male insecurity is so much more," he added. He further said he gets a lot of trust from actresses like Taapsee Pannu, Saiyami Kher and Amruta Subhash. "I can't work if I don't get trust," he stated.

158.title: Govt to distribute 6 lakh clay idols for Ganesh Chaturthi in Hyderabad
158.article_body: Several departments in Hyderabad are reportedly getting ready to distribute over six lakh clay idols ahead of the upcoming Ganesh Chaturthi festival. The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) will reportedly distribute four lakh clay idols, while Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) and Telangana State Pollution Control Board (TSPCB) will distribute one lakh idols each.

159.title: The All New Hot & Techy Brezza is here, in a new avatar: Maruti Suzuki
159.article_body: Maruti Suzuki shared that its all-new hot and techy Brezza enables its young audience to embark on city adventures. The car is equipped with features like Head Up Display, Electric Sunroof, 360 View Camera, Dual LED Projector Headlamps with Floating LED DRLs, LED Tail Lamps, and dual-tone exteriors and more. The city-bred SUV is priced at ₹7.99 lakh

160.title: Female teacher set on fire in front of public in Rajasthan, locals take videos
160.article_body: A 32-year-old female teacher was set on fire by criminals in full public view near Rajasthan's Jaipur, with locals seen taking videos of the act. The victim had loaned money to the accused and had been demanding it back, reports said. The accused would hit and abuse her for demanding money back, reports added. The woman succumbed to her injuries.

161.title: You want to ask me that question, come to India: Jaishankar to Tamil man in Thailand
161.article_body: While interacting with the Indian community in Bangkok, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar  was asked about the Centre-state conflict in reference to Tamil Nadu by a Tamil man. EAM Jaishankar replied, "I don't get into Indian politics when I go abroad. You want to ask me that question, come to India and I will be very happy to answer."

162.title: 31-year-old businesswoman stabbed to death at her shop in Pune
162.article_body: A 31-year-old businesswoman named Pooja Devi Prasad was stabbed to death on Tuesday by an unknown person in Pune's Bhosari, police said. The accused stabbed Pooja at her cloth shop 'Pragati Collection' shortly after she opened it on Tuesday morning. After being stabbed, Pooja tried to catch the assailant and chased him for some distance before he escaped, police said.

163.title: MP Minister, relatives escape unhurt after truck rams into his car
163.article_body: A truck rammed into the official car of MP Minister Tulsi Ram Silawat when he was travelling to Bhopal with his family members, but all of them escaped unhurt, a police official said. The truck hit the car from the side, which left the left side door of the vehicle damaged, he added. The truck driver was detained.

164.title: 19-yr-old served spiked drink, gang-raped after birthday party in UP
164.article_body: A 19-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped after a birthday party on Sunday in Ghaziabad's Modinagar town in Uttar Pradesh, police said. Somebody served her drink laced with sedatives, police added. Later, a man took her to a room and also called his friends and they took turns allegedly raping her, police further said. All three accused have been arrested.

165.title: There was a 'communication gap': Asgar on fallout with Kapil Sharma
165.article_body: Discussing his fallout with comedian Kapil Sharma, having quit 'The Kapil Sharma Show' in 2017, comedian Ali Asgar said, "There was a communication gap." Kapil had earlier stated that he would "block" Asgar as he didn't know the reason behind him leaving the show. Talking about his exit from the show, Asgar stated, "I can't cheat as an artiste."

166.title: Kamal Haasan drops hint on 'Indian 2' on director Shankar's b'day
166.article_body: In a tweet wishing director Shankar on his birthday, Kamal Haasan dropped a hint on 'Indian 2'. Calling Shankar a director who "made heads turn" with his films, Kamal wrote, "Let's take pride as 'Indian'. Together let's achieve more." 'Indian 2' went on floors in 2019 but the shoot was put on hold due to an accident in 2020.

167.title: Traffic movement to be slow at several places in Mumbai due to Motorbike rally
167.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police has announced that the vehicular movement will be slow at several places in Mumbai between 12.30 pm to 4 pm due to Motorbike rally. Taking to Twitter, Mumbai Traffic Police wrote, "Vehicular movement will be slow between International Airport-WEH-Milan Subway-Vakola Bridge-Kherwadi Bridge-Kalanagar Bridge- Bandra Stn-Hotel Avsari Jn-Shivaji Park- Chaityabhoomi."

168.title: Not Ananya, Jahnvi was the 1st choice for 'Liger': Director Puri Jagannadh
168.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh has revealed that his first choice for 'Liger', opposite Vijay Deverakonda, was Janhvi Kapoor and not Ananya Panday. "I am a big fan of Sridevi Ji. And I wanted to cast Janhvi for the role. But then the dates weren't available," Puri said. Filmmaker Karan Johar later suggested him to cast Ananya Panday in the film.

169.title: Karnataka to provide 2% reservation to sportspersons in all state depts
169.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai on Tuesday announced that his government will provide two per cent reservation in all state departments to sportspersons on the lines of the existing quota in the police and forest department. The government has understood that the sportspersons need security for their lives, he said at a function organised to felicitate 75 sportspersons.

170.title: Vijay Deverakonda, Kartik Aaryan could be in my swayamvar: Kriti Sanon
170.article_body: Kriti Sanon, speaking about her potential swayamvar, said Vijay Deverakonda and Kartik Aaryan could be a part of it. Talking about Vijay, Kriti stated he's good-looking and sensible. She also named actor Aditya Roy Kapur to be a part of her potential swayamvar. Kriti added, "I'd love to work with Ryan Gosling...I'd also like him to be in my swayamvar."

171.title: Congress supporting anti-nationals all across the country: BJP leader
171.article_body: BJP MLA KS Eshwarappa on Wednesday said that Congress is not only supporting anti-nationals in Karnataka or South India, but all across the country. "I want to attack directly," the BJP leader said amid communal tension in Shivamogga. "The man who removed Savarkar's photo is an SDPI worker whose wife is a Congress councillor," Eshwarappa said.

172.title: 2 former Congress leaders join BJP ahead of Gujarat Assembly elections
172.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly elections, former Congress leaders Naresh Raval and Raju Parmar joined BJP in Gandhinagar on Wednesday. While Raval had served as Gujarat Home Minister in the then Congress government, Parmar was elected as Congress' Rajya Sabha member from Gujarat for three terms, between 1988 and 2006. Both the leaders had quit Congress nearly two weeks ago.

173.title: Concern is about spending public money in right way: SC on 'freebies'
173.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday heard a plea against practice of promising "freebies" during election campaigns.
