A bench headed by CJI NV Ramana said the concern is about spending public money in the right way. The court was hearing a petition by BJP leader and lawyer Ashwini Upadhyay seeking to prevent political parties from promising "freebies" to electorate before elections.

174.title: Man lured by high crypto profits loses ₹13 lakh to scammers in Pune
174.article_body: A pharmaceutical company's manager was cheated of around ₹13 lakh by cyber criminals, according to an FIR registered at Pune police station on Monday. Posing as a Bitcoin trading executive, a scammer lured the man into engaging in cryptocurrency trading by promising him high profits. He paid around ₹13 lakh to the scammers as commission or tax on his profits.

175.title: Tencent records its first-ever revenue drop in April-June quarter
175.article_body: China's Tencent on Wednesday reported its first-ever revenue decline, hurt by lack of game approvals, regulations limiting playing time and COVID-19 lockdowns. Tencent's revenue fell 3% YoY to 134.03 billion yuan ($19.78 billion) while its profit fell 56% YoY to 18.62 billion yuan ($2.74 billion) in April-June quarter. It also reported its first-ever shrink in workforce, which fell 4.7% QoQ.

176.title: You're an idiot: Geoffrey Boycott on England's 'Bazball' approach in Tests
176.article_body: Talking about England's attacking 'Bazball' approach in Test cricket, ex-England cricketer Geoffrey Boycott said, "If you think you're going to plunder the best bowlers [bowling] with a [new ball]...then you're an idiot." Boycott further said that England's top-order batsmen don't know how to play the new ball. "Job is to get through the new ball for your team," stated Boycott.

177.title: China orders factories to close amid worst heatwave in 6 decades
177.article_body: Authorities in several Chinese cities have ordered factories to temporarily close as the nation faces its worst heatwave in 60 years. Sichuan, a key manufacturing location for semiconductor industries, has ordered all factories to shut down for six days to ease the power shortage. Power cuts in Sichuan will reportedly hit factories belonging to some of the biggest electronic companies.

178.title: Central Railway to use bedsheets made by Pune's Yerawada jail inmates
178.article_body: Central Railway (CR) has decided to use bedsheets made by Pune's Yerawada Central Jail inmates. As a pilot project, 89 handmade bedsheets will be supplied to Mumbai CSMT-Nizamuddin Rajdhani Express and Pune-Ahmedabad Duronto Express. "It's being done on an experimental basis...after feedback from passengers...bedsheets will be made available on more such trains," an official said.

179.title: Was taking selfie, 100 people looked at me: Rahman on being only brown guy at H'wood party
179.article_body: Recalling attending a party thrown by Disney for their 2013 film 'Frozen', music composer AR Rahman said, "It was also the 90th birthday of Walt Disney so there was a statue of him." He added, "So...I was taking a selfie (with the statue), I look back and 100 people were looking at me. I was the only brown person there."

180.title: Railways considering semi-high speed track between B'luru, Hyderabad: Report
180.article_body: Indian Railways is considering building a semi-high speed track between Bengaluru and Hyderabad which may reduce travel time to less than 2.5 hours, according to reports. The track will reportedly be compatible for running trains at a speed of 200 km/hour. The track will be built between Bengaluru's Yelahanka Station and Hyderabad's Secunderabad Station, covering a distance of 503 km.

181.title: Country seeing difference between PM's words, deeds: Rahul on Bilkis Bano case
181.article_body: After 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment in Bilkis Bano gangrape case walked free in Gujarat, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi asked, "What message is being given to the women of the country by those who peddle lies about 'naari shakti'?" "Prime Minister Ji, the entire country is seeing the difference between your words and deeds," Gandhi added.

182.title: 14-yr-old abducts, rapes 3-year-old girl in a field in Haryana
182.article_body: A three-year-old girl was allegedly abducted and raped by a 14-year-old in a field in Haryana's Nuh district. The girl's mother was unaware that her daughter was following her to the field and didn't realise when the accused abducted her daughter. I heard my daughter crying when I was going to the field, the victim's father said.

183.title: 3 ex-Noida fire officers booked for issuing fire NOC to twin towers
183.article_body: Three former Chief Fire Officers (CFOs) of Noida have been booked over alleged irregularities in providing no objection certificate (NOC) to Supertech's illegal twin towers in Noida Sector 93A. The action has been taken based on the report of the inquiry committee constituted under the chairmanship of DIG Fire Services. FIR has been lodged at Phase 2 police station.

184.title: Vijay Deverakonda's mother holds pooja for him & Ananya at Hyd home
184.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda's mother organised a pooja for him and his 'Liger' co-star Ananya Panday at their home in Hyderabad ahead of their film's release on August 25. Sharing photos from the pooja on Twitter, he wrote, "This whole month touring across India and receiving so much love already felt like God's blessing! But mummy feels we needed His protection."

185.title: ICC releases men's Future Tours Program for 2023 to 2027
185.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday released the men's 2023-2027 Future Tours Program (FTP) cycle. The 12 full members of the ICC will play a total of 777 international matches, including 173 Tests, 281 ODIs and 323 T20Is, in the 2023-2027 FTP cycle compared to the 694 in the current one. India will be playing 38 Test matches in 2023-2027 FTP cycle.

186.title: Nitin Gadkari, Shivraj Singh Chouhan dropped from BJP's Parliamentary Board
186.article_body: The BJP on Wednesday dropped Union Minister Nitin Gadkari and Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan from its Parliamentary Board, the party's highest organisation body. BS Yediyurappa, Sarbananda Sonowal, Iqbal Singh Lalpura, Satyanarayan Jatiya, K Laxman and Sudha Yadav were included in the Board. The Board, headed by JP Nadda, also has PM Narendra Modi, Rajnath Singh and Amit Shah.

187.title: Kashmiri Hindus protest in J&K's Budgam over targeted killings
187.article_body: A group of Kashmiri Hindus on Wednesday staged a protest in J&K's Budgam district after Kashmiri Pandit Sunil Kumar was killed by terrorists on Tuesday. Demonstrators reportedly demanded justice for Sunil's family and asked to be relocated to safer places. "Terrorists...made it clear...they're going to kill all...Kashmiri Pandits," said Kashmiri Pandit Sangarash Samiti (KPSS) chief Sanjay Tickoo.

188.title: Philips CEO Frans van Houten to be replaced amid ventilators recall
188.article_body: Philips Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Frans van Houten will step down from the post, the Dutch health technology firm said on Tuesday. He will be replaced by Roy Jakobs, the head of the company's Connected Care businesses, on October 15. This comes after a recall of its ventilators cut Philips' market value by more than half over the past year.

189.title: Singer jumps 16% after Jhunjhunwala's firm buys 42.5 lakh shares
189.article_body:
Shares of Singer India jumped over 16% in early trade on Wednesday after late billionaire investor 
Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's RARE Investments bought 42,50,000 shares in the company. Singer's shares had hit the upper limit on Tuesday. RARE Investments bought the shares at ₹53.50 apiece after Retail Holdings India BV sold about 22% stake in the firm through bulk deals.

190.title: I don't know: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Law Minister Kartikeya Singh facing arrest
190.article_body: Commenting on Bihar Law Minister Kartikeya Singh's allegedly outstanding arrest warrant, CM Nitish Kumar said that he has no information about the same. "I do not know," Nitish told reporters. Singh and 17 others are accused in a 2014 kidnapping case. "Is Nitish trying to take Bihar back to Lalu's times?" BJP's Sushil Kumar Modi remarked.

191.title: Request PM to reverse Guj govt’s order: KTR as Bilkis rape convicts walk free
191.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao has requested PM Narendra Modi to intervene in a matter where 11 life imprisonment convicts in Bilkis Bano gangrape case were released from Godhra sub-jail under Gujarat government's remission policy. "I request PM to…reverse Gujarat government’s order...it's sending out a wrong message that a rapist walks out of jail and is welcomed," Rao added.

192.title: Zinc soars as Nyrstar's Budel smelter announces halt in production
192.article_body: After Nyrstar's Budel smelter announced it would halt production from September 1, zinc prices surged nearly 7.2% on the London Metal Exchange on Tuesday. Budel smelter, which is one of the largest in Europe, has been operating at a reduced rate since Q4 of the last fiscal because of soaring energy prices. Smelters require high amounts of electricity to operate.

193.title: Google showcases AI robots that fetch soda, chips
193.article_body: Google has showcased AI robots that help its employees fetch soda and chips from breakrooms with ease. The robots are not ready for sale. "It's going to take a while before we can really have a firm grasp on the direct commercial impact," Google said. The company has not yet embedded them with the "OK, Google" summoning feature.

194.title: I’m happy to be essaying realistic police officer: Drashti on 'Duranga'
194.article_body: Actress Drashti Dhami, speaking about her upcoming OTT series 'Duranga', said she is happy to play a realistic police officer. "I feel more people will be able to resonate with my character because she's a wife and mother at home and a cop at work," she added. 'Duranga' is an adaptation of the South Korean drama 'Flower of Evil'.

195.title: Holiday over, work begins: Kartik as he returns to 'Shehzada' sets
195.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan took to Instagram Stories and shared a selfie as he returned to the sets of his upcoming film 'Shehzada'. Along with the picture, he wrote, "Chutti khatam, kaam shuru (Holiday over, work begins)." The film, which is directed by Rohit Dhawan, will also feature actress Kriti Sanon. The actor recently featured in Anees Bazmee's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

196.title: There hasn't been a more important series than this Asia Cup for Kohli: Sodhi
196.article_body: Former India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi has said that there hasn't been a more important tournament than the upcoming Asia Cup for Virat Kohli in recent years. "Fingers crossed, we all are praying that we see Virat Kohli in excellent form in the Asia Cup," added Sodhi. Virat has been on break since India's tour of England.

197.title: After Ghulam Nabi Azad, 3 more leaders quit J&K Congress posts
197.article_body: After Ghulam Nabi Azad, three more senior Congress leaders quit the party's newly formed committees in Jammu and Kashmir within hours of being nominated. The other leaders include two-time MLA from Sopore, Haji Abdul Rashid, Mohammad Amin Bhat and Gulzar Ahmed Wani. Azad was made Jammu and Kashmir campaign committee chairman and was also named on the political affairs committee.

198.title: SRK said he would've done my role if he was younger: Vijay on Darlings
198.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma, who played the role of an abusive husband in 'Darlings', with Alia Bhatt portraying his wife, said actor Shah Rukh Khan stated he would have done the role "if he was younger". Vijay had earlier shared that SRK "thanked" him for doing the film. However, Vijay admitted that he thought his career will "end" following this portrayal.

199.title: Bengaluru-based Exponent Energy raises $13 mn in Series A round
199.article_body: Bengaluru-based electric vehicle charging infrastructure company, Exponent Energy, has secured $13 million in a Series A funding round. The round was led by Lightspeed Venture Partners and saw participation of existing investors like YourNest Venture Capital, 3one4 Capital and AdvantEdge Founders. The company had raised $6 million in seed and Pre-Series A funding round in December 2021.

200.title: Red panda, leopard skins recovered from North Bengal, 3 arrested
200.article_body: Two red panda skins and one leopard skin were seized from three wildlife traffickers in North Bengal’s New Jalpaiguri on Tuesday, officials said. The three arrested accused are citizens of Nepal. "All three are habitual offenders. They...entered India with skins from Nepal and were going to...Bhutan where consignment was to be delivered for ₹30 lakh," a senior forest official said.

201.title: UK inflation surges to 10.1% in July, its highest in 40 years
201.article_body: British consumer price inflation surged to 10.1% in July, which is the highest it has been since February 1982, data from the Office for National Statistics showed on Wednesday. The figures showed that prices rose by 0.6% in July from June on a non-seasonally adjusted basis. The annual retail price inflation rate reached 12.3%, the highest since March 1981.

202.title: BEST's 1st e-double-decker bus likely to be in public service from Sept: Report
202.article_body: Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport's (BEST) first electric double-decker bus in Mumbai is expected to be commissioned for the public in September 2022, as per a report. The first double-decker electric bus will likely be unveiled on 18 August 2022, the report said quoting sources. The prototype electric double-decker bus is ready with all necessary permissions, the reports added.

203.title: Arvind Kejriwal launches 'Make India No. 1' mission
203.article_body: Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal has launched the 'Make India No. 1' mission. "We have to make India great again," Kejriwal said. "It has been 75 years of Independence. India gained a lot but there's...a question among people that several small nations that attained independence after us, surpassed us...Why did India lag behind?" Kejriwal added.

204.title: Nandan Nilekani interrupts interviewer to ask meaning of 'OG', video surfaces
204.article_body: A video has surfaced online wherein Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani could be seen interrupting an interviewer to ask the meaning of OG. While the interviewer referred to Infosys as the "OG for entrepreneurship in India", Nilekani interrupted and asked, "What is OG?", to which she clarified, "The original gangster." Commenting on the video, a user wrote, "What a sweet moment."

205.title: MP gets 1st Vistadome coach in Bhopal-Jabalpur Jan Shatabdi Exp
205.article_body: With the introduction of a Vistadome coach in Bhopal-Jabalpur Jan Shatabdi Express, Madhya Pradesh got its first Vistadome coach, railway officials said. Principal Secretary of the tourism and culture department, Sheo Shekhar Shukla, said that with this coach, tourists can enjoy the views of the hills, rivers and nature between the two cities. The coach is equipped with large windows.

206.title: 5 foreigners charged as mercenaries in Donetsk, 3 face death penalty
206.article_body: A Russia-backed court in Donetsk region has charged five foreign nationals with being mercenaries, out of whom, three face death penalty, according to Russian state media. The five foreign nationals from Britain, Croatia and Sweden were captured in and around Mariupol while fighting with Ukrainian forces. In June, Donetsk authorities sentenced two Britons and one Moroccan citizen to death.

207.title: Aadhaar number mandatory to get govt benefits and subsidies: UIDAI
207.article_body: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has said that if a citizen doesn't have an Aadhaar number, he/she may not be entitled to avail government subsidies and benefits. The UIDAI said that a citizen may avail the benefits, subsidies and services through alternate and viable means of identification along with Aadhaar enrolment identification number till Aadhaar number is assigned.

208.title: China's Sichuan limits power supply to homes, offices amid heatwave
208.article_body: Authorities in China's Sichuan province began limiting electricity supply to homes, offices and malls on Wednesday due to a power crunch triggered by heatwave and drought, state media reports said. Government offices have been asked to not set air conditioners lower than 26 Celsius (78.8°F). Commercial and recreational activities like fountain and light shows during night hours will be suspended.

209.title: My Test career was 'almost over' before it started: Lee on McGrath's prank
209.article_body: Discussing a prank played on him by ex-Australian player Glenn McGrath during his Test debut, ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said, "Adam Gilchrist was...telling me to...enjoy and while I was listening...McGrath...[tied] my shoelaces together." "When I hopped up, I fell over. My Test career was almost over before it started," added Lee. "McGrath...would always...[play] a practical joke," he stated.

210.title: ‘Vinash shakti’ won in Guj: Chidambaram on Bilkis rape convicts released from jail
210.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram said "vinash shakti" has won in Gujarat, after 11 life imprisonment convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case walked free in Gujarat. "Are you not shocked by pictures of 11 released men being welcomed with sweets?" Chidambaram tweeted. "Did the PM not know about the proposed action of the Gujarat government?" he asked.

211.title: N Korea fires 2 cruise missiles amid US-S Korea joint drill
211.article_body: North Korea fired two cruise missiles from the town of Onchon on Wednesday, a South Korean military source said. On Tuesday, US and South Korea kicked off a four-day preliminary joint drill in preparation for upcoming Ulchi Freedom Shield exercise. South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol said he's willing to provide phased economic aid to North Korea if it begins denuclearisation.

212.title: 5 of family, including 2 kids, killed as truck hits car near Pune
212.article_body: Five members of a family, including two kids aged four and seven, died and one person was severely injured when a container truck rammed into their car near Pune on Wednesday morning, police said. The incident occurred on Pune-Ahmednagar highway. Pune Police Superintendent Abhinav Deshmukh said the truck driver fled after the accident and search was on to arrest him.

213.title: Finland, Sweden's NATO bids will progress very quickly: Germany's Scholz
213.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has said Finland and Sweden's NATO bids will "progress very quickly", and members including Turkey will ratify them soon. "In Finland and Sweden, we are gaining two valued allies," Scholz said. The two Nordic countries that remained neutral during the Cold War, applied to join NATO after the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

214.title: 4,000 litres of adulterated milk seized in Gujarat's Rajkot: Police
214.article_body: Four thousand litres of adulterated milk was seized from a truck at a checkpoint in Gujarat's Rajkot, police said. "A truck was stopped during checking of vehicles and adulterated milk that was made from chemicals like sulfates, phosphates and carbonate oils was seized," Rajkot DCP Praveen Kumar Meena said. "Adulterated milk was being supplied for last four months," he added.

215.title: Lebanese man who held up bank to access his own savings released
215.article_body: A Lebanese judge ordered the release of a man who last week took staff at a Beirut bank hostage for accessing his frozen savings. Bassam al-Sheikh Hussein surrendered after being permitted to withdraw $35,000, which he termed necessary for paying hospital bills. A crowd had gathered during the hostage situation with many chanting, "Down with the rule of the banks!"

216.title: E Palaniswami's appointment as AIADMK General Secretary not valid: Madras HC
216.article_body: E Palaniswami's appointment as All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) General Secretary is not valid, Madras High Court said. Palaniswami has been the AIADMK General Secretary since July 11, 2022. AIADMK's O Panneerselvam had filed a plea against the party's July 11 General Council meeting. Notably, Palaniswami is also the Leader of the Opposition in the Tamil Nadu Assembly.

217.title: 'Award-winning' director turns bike taxi driver in B'luru; chat with customer goes viral
217.article_body: A Twitter user's thread about his conversation with a bike taxi driver in Bengaluru has gone viral. The user said that the driver, who lost his job during the coronavirus pandemic, is also an award-winning director. "Created a Mini-series by investing all savings. Series got a great response and won around 15 Film Fests," the user said about the driver.

218.title: Chinese woman sues colleague for breaking ribs while hugging, gets ₹1 lakh compensation
218.article_body: A Chinese woman sued her colleague after he allegedly broke three of her ribs while hugging her. She said that the male colleague gave her an extremely tight hug leaving her in discomfort. She received medical attention after the pain stayed for about five days. Subsequently, a judge ordered the co-worker to pay her 10,000 yuan (₹1.16 lakh) as compensation.

219.title: They need to respect my terms too: Russell on Simmons' 'can't beg' remark
219.article_body: Responding to WI head coach Phil Simmons' remark that he can't beg people to play for their country, all-rounder Andre Russell, who hasn't played for WI since November 2021, said he still wants to win at least one more WC for the Windies. "But...we're not agreeing on certain terms...they have to respect my terms as well," he added.

220.title: More resignations likely if attention not paid: Handa as Azad quits J&K Cong post
220.article_body: Following Congress’ Ghulam Nabi Azad’s resignation from the post of chairman of the J&K campaign committee, party leader Ashwani Handa said that the right message is not reaching the high command. "If they don't pay attention to this committee, more resignations are likely. Everyone is feeling neglected," Handa added. Azad resigned from the post hours after the appointment.

221.title: BJP-JJP coalition govt believes in event management: Ex-Haryana CM
221.article_body: Former Haryana CM and Leader of Opposition Bhupinder Singh Hooda said the BJP-JJP coalition government believes in "event management". He claimed Haryana was a "knowledge hub" when Congress was in power, however, now state universities are falling out of the top 100. "This is because...a non-performing government, which only believes in event management, is running the state," he added.

222.title: Ravi Shastri had 'very low' tolerance for failure: Dinesh Karthik
222.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said ex-Team India head coach Ravi Shastri had "very low" tolerance for failure. "He had a very low tolerance for somebody who would bat at a certain pace he did not like or someone who was doing very differently in the nets and in the match, he would go and bat differently," added Karthik.

223.title: He should've just pulled his hair: NBA star Hart on Nunez's headbutt
223.article_body: NBA player Josh Hart has tweeted that Liverpool's Darwin Nunez would have escaped without punishment, if he had "pulled" Crystal Palace defender Joachim Andersen's hair, rather than headbutting him. Hart was referring to Tottenham Hotspur's Cristian Romero getting away without a booking for pulling Chelsea defender Marc Cucurella's hair during a match. Nunez was sent off following his headbutt.

224.title: Bengaluru to face scheduled power cuts from August 17-19
224.article_body: Several areas in Bengaluru will face power cuts from August 17-19 between 10 am and 6 pm due to repair and maintenance work undertaken by the Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM). The areas that will be affected today include Alagatta, Kenchamma Naguhalli, Hosur, etc. Whereas, areas that will be affected on August 18 include Hanumanthapura, Marenahalli, Rangapura, etc.

225.title: Vijay Deverakonda arrives at 'Liger' event in auto-rickshaw, video surfaces
225.article_body: A video of actor Vijay Deverakonda arriving at the sets of a dance reality show in Mumbai for promoting his upcoming film 'Liger' in an auto-rickshaw has surfaced on social media. In the video, Vijay can be seen wearing a white outfit. Reacting to the video, a fan commented, "Real hero with no attitude...very humble."

226.title: Chocolates worth ₹17 lakh stolen from Cadbury godown in UP: Report
226.article_body: About 150 cartons of Cadbury chocolate bars worth ₹17 lakh were reportedly stolen from a godown in Chinhat area of Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. The incident occurred on the intervening night of Monday and Tuesday, the reports added. The godown was earlier the home of Cadbury distributor Rajendra Singh Sidhu, who recently shifted to an apartment in Gomti Nagar.

227.title: Jacqueline named as accused in ED chargesheet in ₹200 crore extortion case: Report
227.article_body: Jacqueline Fernandez has been named as an accused in the Enforcement Directorate's supplementary chargesheet filed in the ₹200 crore extortion case against conman Sukesh Chandrashekar, reports said on Wednesday. Reports said that she was aware of the extortion taking place. The ED had earlier attached ₹7.27 crore funds of Fernandez under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA).

228.title: Over 150 children dead in Zimbabwe measles outbreak
228.article_body: A measles outbreak in Zimbabwe has killed at least 157 children, with the death toll nearly doubling in less than a week, the government said. The total number of suspected measles cases nationwide has risen from 1,036 to 2,056 in just four days, Information Minister Monica Mutsvangwa said. Earlier, the government had blamed gatherings of religious sects for the outbreak.

229.title: 21-yr-old student from Puducherry dies of suspected drug overdose in Goa
229.article_body: A 21-year-old college student from Puducherry died of a suspected drug overdose at Goa Medical College and Hospital, a police spokesperson said. He was admitted to the hospital in serious condition on Tuesday, the spokesperson added. The youth had arrived in Goa along with his three friends on Saturday. However, his friends claimed he had not consumed any narcotics substances.

230.title: Anupam shares pics from David Dhawan's b'day party, says 'We're the best'
230.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher took to Instagram and shared pictures from filmmaker David Dhawan's birthday party. He posted pictures with David, Satish Kaushik, Shakti Kapoor, Chunky Panday and Rajpal Yadav. Along with the pictures, he wrote, "With birthday boy David Dhawan and my dearest friends who I have spent some memorable times with!! We are the best."

231.title: Apple suppliers to produce Apple Watch, MacBook in Vietnam: Report
231.article_body: Apple's suppliers are mulling over producing Apple Watch and MacBook in Vietnam for the first time, Nikkei Asia reported. According to reports, Apple suppliers Foxconn and Luxshare Precision Industry have started test production of Apple Watch and MacBook in Northern Vietnam. Apple has been shifting some areas of iPhone production from China to other markets, including India.

232.title: Woman dragged on road in snatching incident in Delhi; act caught on CCTV
232.article_body: A 46-year-old woman was dragged on the road when two bike-borne men pulled her bag in Delhi's Greater Kailash market. The incident, which took place on July 30, was caught on CCTV in which the woman can be seen falling down and being dragged. The victim was heading towards her guest house after having dinner when the incident happened.

233.title: Water level of Yamuna crosses warning level in Delhi
233.article_body: Water level of Yamuna river in Delhi crossed the warning mark of 204.5 metres today. The surge in water level happened after Haryana released more water from Hathnikund Barrage amid rains in the upper catchment areas, officials said. This is the second time water level crossed danger mark in August. Earlier on August 12, the river crossed 205.33 metres mark.

234.title: Sexual harassment complaint won't prima facie stand if woman wore provocative dress: Court
234.article_body: While granting anticipatory bail to social activist Civic Chandran in a sexual harassment case, a Kerala Court observed that the offence under Section 354A of the Indian Penal Code is not prima facie attracted if the woman is wearing "sexually provocative dresses". The court expressed disbelief that the physically disabled accused could forcefully put the complainant in his lap.

235.title: Oil prices recover from 6-month low as US crude oil stockpiles drop
235.article_body: With a drop in US oil and gasoline stockpiles, oil prices recovered from a six-month low and increased on Wednesday even as investors are assured of a resilient demand. Brent futures rose to $92.47 a barrel, while West Texas Intermediate futures increased to $86.80 a barrel. Crude stocks fell by 4,48,000 barrels for the week ended August 12, sources said.

236.title: Your healthy lifestyle starts with picking the right cooking oil: Oleev
236.article_body: Oleev Active with the goodness of olive oil is specially created to fulfil the demands of the modern lifestyle, said the brand. It has an Energocules formula that will ensure you stay active and energized throughout the day, it revealed, adding that after all, you are what you eat.

237.title: 'New TMC in 6 months' posters with Abhishek Banerjee's photos put up in Kolkata
237.article_body: Posters claiming that "new and reformed TMC will come into being in six months", with photographs of TMC National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee have been put up in various parts of Kolkata. The posters didn't have West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee’s photo. "Maybe some over-enthusiastic party workers put up posters with his quotes issued in past," TMC's Kunal Ghosh said.

238.title: She questions you which is 'very irritating': Kashyap on Taapsee Pannu
238.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, whose upcoming film 'Dobaaraa' stars actress Taapsee Pannu, said she "pushes" him a lot. "She questions you which irritates you a lot. Taapsee keeps needling till she gets an answer," added Kashyap. Kashyap jokingly stated that Taapsee was soft-spoken when they first met, adding that she barged into his room and yelled the next time they met.

239.title: Cricket would lose something fundamental if we watch T20s only: Hussain
239.article_body: Talking about the emergence of multiple T20 franchise leagues in the world, former England captain Nasser Hussain said, "Cricket would be losing something fundamental if the only format we watch is T20 franchise stuff." Hussain added, "One area of concern is the extent to which white-ball cricket is now getting hold of players at the start of their careers."

240.title: Sensex crosses 60,000 mark for 1st time in over 4 months
240.article_body: BSE Sensex on Wednesday crossed the 60,000 mark for the first time during intraday trade since April 5. Meanwhile, NSE Nifty is currently trading at 17,923. Notably, the benchmark indices had opened on a higher note amid positive global trends. On Sensex, NTPC, Hindustan Unilever, Bajaj Finance, Asian Paints, UltraTech Cement and Reliance Industries were among the gainers.

241.title: Was paid much less in 'Jurassic...' than the reports said: Bryce Dallas
241.article_body: Actress Bryce Dallas Howard revealed that she was paid "so much less" for the 'Jurassic World' franchise than the reports suggested. "When I started negotiating for [Jurassic World], it was 2014...it was a different world and I was at a great disadvantage," she said. She added, "Unfortunately, you have to sign up for three movies...so your deals are set."

242.title: Largest aircraft Airbus A380 to land in B'luru for 1st time in October
242.article_body: The Airbus A380, which is the world's largest aircraft, will be deployed on the Bengaluru-Dubai route for the first time starting October 30. Emirates airline will be operating the double-decker aircraft service to and from Bengaluru. The aircraft will have three-class configurations apart from premium cabins, offering seats in Economy Class, Business Class and First Class.

243.title: Work on 4 Metro stations in Pune to be completed by August 31
243.article_body: The Maha Metro has sped up work on four stations in Pune, including Deccan Gymkhana, Chhatrapati Sambhaji Udyan, Pune Municipal Corporation and Civil Court, and is expected to finish it by August 31. According to an official, work on all four stations is 80% complete. "We're committed to open...remaining sections...in the coming months," said Maha Metro's Managing Director Brijesh Dixit.

244.title: Shinde-led Maharashtra govt announces 3% rise in DA for 17 lakh employees
244.article_body: Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government on Tuesday announced a 3% rise in the dearness allowance (DA) payable to nearly 17 lakh government employees in the state. "This increase will be paid in cash from August 2022. Due to today's cabinet decision, the dearness allowance of state government employees will be increased from 31% to 34%," Shinde said on Tuesday.

245.title: 'Please leave me alone', says Bilkis Bano as 11 convicts in gangrape case walk free
245.article_body: A day after 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment for gangraping Bilkis Bano and killing seven members of her family walked free in Gujarat, she said, "Please leave me alone...I've offered 'duas' for the soul of my daughter Saleha." Her husband Yakub Rasool said Bilkis couldn't believe they walked free, adding, she first broke into tears and then went silent.

246.title: Boult's IPL contract is ₹8 cr, he'll make more money in T20 leagues : Ashwin
246.article_body: India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has said pacer Trent Boult, who recently gave up his central contract, will make more money by playing in the T20 leagues than what he'll make by playing for New Zealand. "For that professional and financial liberation, he's not signing the central contract," added Ashwin. Boult was bought by RR for ₹8 crore in IPL auction.

247.title: Kenya's opposition leader to challenge presidential poll result after losing
247.article_body: After Kenya's Deputy President William Ruto won the presidential election, opposition leader Raila Odinga said that he would pursue all legal options to challenge the outcome. As per the official tally, Ruto narrowly beat his rival Odinga with 50.5% votes. Odinga called the figures declared by the election commission as "null and void", and his supporters alleged rampant electoral malpractice.

248.title: Musk says he was joking about buying Manchester Utd, tweets 'Not buying any sports teams'
248.article_body: Responding to a Twitter user, the world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk clarified that he is not buying football club Manchester United. He wrote, "This is a long-running joke on Twitter. I'm not buying any sports teams." Earlier on Wednesday, Musk while commenting on a thread of political allegiances, tweeted, "I'm buying Manchester United ur welcome."

249.title: It's common; be it anything, trolling is always there: Vijay Deverakonda
249.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda opened up about social media trolling and said that it's an everyday thing. "It's common...Even before I became an actor, aunties...uncles used to troll about results, college, job, etc. and now it's social media trolling," he added. Vijay stated, "Be it anything, trolling is always there." Vijay will next be seen in 'Liger', which also features Ananya Panday.

250.title: Activist who opposed MP's Khargone bulldozer drive arrested under NSA
250.article_body: Muslim activist Zaid Pathan, who opposed the Madhya Pradesh government's Khargone bulldozer drive, has been arrested under the National Security Act (NSA). Pathan was arrested for allegedly disturbing communal harmony and posting objectionable posts on social media, Indore DM Manish Singh said. Khargone bulldozer drive had taken place following violence during Ram Navami processions.

251.title: T'gana Minister reviews arrangements for Ganesh festival in Hyderabad
251.article_body: Telangana Animal Husbandry Minister Talasani Srinivas Yadav on Tuesday reviewed arrangements for Ganesh festival in Hyderabad. During the meeting, Talasani asked officials to repair damaged roads related to the routes of Ganesh procession within stipulated period. Further, state Home Minister Mahmood Ali directed police officials to deploy additional forces and 'SHE Teams' in suspected areas.

252.title: Senior UN official visits Myanmar to meet military leadership
252.article_body: A senior United Nations official, Noeleen Heyzer, arrived in the capital of Myanmar, Naypyidaw, on Tuesday to meet the country's military chief Min Aung Hlaing. "She will focus on addressing the deteriorating situation and immediate concerns," UN said in a statement. A junta spokesperson said that Heyzer has not requested to meet former Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi.

253.title: Sri Lanka says it's not paying for ex-Prez Rajapaksa's expenses abroad
253.article_body: The Sri Lankan government said that it's not paying for the overseas stay of ex-President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who fled the country after mass protests. "All such expenses are borne by the personal funds of the former President," the Information Department said. Rajapaksa is currently in Thailand. He arrived in Thailand last week from Singapore after his short-term visit pass expired.

254.title: CNG price reduced by ₹4 per kg in Pune
254.article_body: Price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) has been reduced by ₹4 per kg in Pune starting today, the All India Petrol Dealers Association said. The CNG will now cost ₹87 per kg which was earlier priced at ₹91 per kg. The price reduction is done on account of a downward revision in the purchase cost of domestic natural gas.

255.title: Ten Hag would've got rid of every Man Utd player if he could: Ferdinand
255.article_body: With Manchester United winless in Premier League after 1-2 and 0-4 defeats against Brighton and Brentford respectively, ex-Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand said the club's manager Erik ten Hag would've "got rid" of every player if possible. "That's the dream scenario," he added. "When you don't have the balls to play, you don't deserve to get the shirt," stated Ferdinand.

256.title: Ghulam Nabi Azad quits J&K Congress post hours after appointment
256.article_body: Senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad resigned from the post of chairman of the Jammu and Kashmir campaign committee, hours after the appointment. He has also resigned from the party's Jammu and Kashmir political affairs committee. Azad cited health reasons while resigning, as per reports. Notably, the Congress campaign committee was newly constituted on Tuesday.

257.title: BMC blames illegal alterations for ceiling collapse in Mumbai's Mulund
257.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has blamed illegal alterations by the contractor for the collapse of ceiling in a residential building in Mumbai's Mulund East on Monday, which killed two senior citizens. The building was neither dilapidated nor dangerous but it was an old structure which was only up to ground floor for over 25 years, a senior official said.

258.title: Soaps can increase pimples, switch to Himalaya Neem Face Wash: Himalaya
258.article_body: Consumers use soap on their face, unaware that it can damage skin and increase pimples, revealed Himalaya. With its campaign, Himalaya aims to empower consumers with scientific knowledge to make right decisions. It urges consumers to trust science and switch to Himalaya Purifying Neem Face Wash claiming that it is 100% soap-free and clinically proven to prevent pimples from recurring.

259.title: Chat with soldier gave me power to do another film after Panipat: Arjun
259.article_body: Arjun Kapoor revealed he was unsure if he would be able to do 'Bhoot Police' after 'Panipat' failed and the theatres were shut due to lockdown. He added he met an army person when he reached Dalhousie for filming 'Bhoot Police'. "I was...broken...underconfident...I talked to him for three minutes...his words gave me the power to do that film," Arjun added.

260.title: All the Khans in B'wood are legends: Ektaa on boycott 'Laal...' trend
260.article_body: Producer Ektaa Kapoor has reacted to the Twitter trend calling for a boycott of Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "All the Khans in the industry (Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan)...especially Aamir, are legends. We cannot boycott them," she said. Ektaa added, "It is so strange we are boycotting the very people who've given the best of business in the industry."

261.title: Social imbalance, people with criminal antecedents: Sushil Modi on Bihar Cabinet
261.article_body: Following Bihar Cabinet expansion, Ex-Bihar Deputy CM and BJP leader Sushil Kumar Modi on Tuesday said the new Cabinet reflects social imbalance and it has faces with criminal antecedents. "Surendra Yadav, Ramanand Yadav and Lalit Yadav, who are these people…What message [does] Nitishji wants to give by including such people in the Cabinet?" Sushil Kumar Modi asked.

262.title: Sania Mirza's sister Anam, Mohammed Asaduddin blessed with a baby girl, name her 'Dua'
262.article_body: Tennis player Sania Mirza's sister Anam and ex-Team India captain Mohammed Azharuddin's son Asaduddin have been blessed with a baby girl. Sharing the news on Instagram, Anam revealed that they have named their first child 'Dua' and wrote, "She’s doing well and so am I. Please keep Our Dua in your duas." Anam and Asaduddin got married in December 2019.

263.title: India reports 9,062 new COVID-19 cases and 36 deaths in 24 hours
263.article_body: India has reported 9,062 new COVID-19 cases and 36 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active cases in the country went down to 1,05,058, while the daily positivity rate declined to 2.49%. India reported 15,220 recoveries in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 4,36,54,064.

264.title: 6 members of a family found dead at their home in Jammu
264.article_body: Six members of a family have been found dead under suspicious circumstances at their home in Jammu's Sidhra locality, police said. The bodies have been taken to the Government Medical College and Hospital in the city, the police told news agency PTI. Teams have arrived at the location and are investigating the incident, the police further said.

265.title: Sensex rises 64.90 points to open at 59,907, Nifty at 17,845
265.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in green on Wednesday with Sensex up 64.90 points at 59,907.11 and Nifty at 17,844.70 with a rise of 19.40 points. NTPC, Grasim Industries, BPCL, Hero MotoCorp and Eicher Motors were among the major Nifty gainers, while the stock of HDFC, HDFC Bank, Infosys, TCS and HCL Technologies slipped. Nearly 1,452 shares advanced and 450 shares declined.

266.title: Serena Williams loses to 19-year-old Emma Raducanu in Cincinnati
266.article_body: Twenty three-time singles' Grand Slam champion Serena Williams lost in straight sets to 19-year-old Emma Raducanu in her final WTA tournament at the Cincinnati Open. Raducanu won the game 6-4, 6-0 to move to the second round. "I can't believe I just played Serena...She's just such a legend," said Raducanu after the game.

267.title: I was asked by wife to see Arjun Reddy, stopped after 45 mins: Liger maker
267.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh, whose upcoming film 'Liger' stars actors Vijay Deverakonda and Ananya Panday, said he was "asked" by his "wife" to watch Vijay's film 'Arjun Reddy' which was criticised for toxic masculinity and being misogynistic. "I stopped after watching the movie for 45 minutes," added Jagannadh. "The reason is that...I felt he acted so honestly," he stated.

268.title: Pune records most deaths as swine flu infections rise in Maharashtra
268.article_body: Pune has recorded the most number of deaths at 13, as Maharashtra has witnessed a rise in the number of swine flu cases. Until mid-August, the state witnessed at least 1,449 swine flu cases out of which 43 patients have died so far. After Pune, Nashik has witnessed six deaths, followed by Thane at five and Nagpur at four.

269.title: Rishi Sunak pledges civil service overhaul if elected UK PM
269.article_body: Ex-UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak pledged a major overhaul of the country's civil service to create a "sharper, leaner" bureaucracy if he's elected as UK's next PM. "I'll strengthen civil servants' experience...allow ministers to bring in more external expertise, and bring in performance pay so we have a truly Rolls Royce service delivering for and accountable to...British people," Sunak said.

270.title: Pregnant woman finds knife in her Subway sandwich in UK; shares pics
270.article_body: A pregnant woman has demanded an apology after finding a sharp knife in her Subway sandwich in UK's Suffolk. A Subway spokesperson said that the chain made four attempts to contact Nerice Moyse to resolve the issue but got no response. The spokesperson also said that the staff apologised as soon as they were made aware of the discovery.

271.title: I don't think Dhawan being captain would've bothered KL Rahul: Kaif
271.article_body: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has said the change in captaincy for the Zimbabwe ODIs could have been "avoided". He added, "If India would have played this series under Shikhar Dhawan, as initially announced, I don't think it would have bothered KL Rahul." Kaif further said, "If someone has been announced as captain, he should remain as captain."

272.title: DMK strong in its ideology, won't compromise with BJP & RSS: Stalin
272.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM and DMK chief MK Stalin on Tuesday said his party is strong in its ideology and it won’t compromise with BJP and RSS. His statement came ahead of his Delhi visit. "There's a relationship between state and Union government and not between DMK and BJP. There's no relationship between parties' ideologies," Stalin added.

273.title: NTPC invites bids from banks to raise ₹5,000 crore term loan
273.article_body: State-run NTPC Limited floated a tender to raise a ₹5,000 crore term loan from banks and financial institutions. The power company will use the proceeds of the loan for capital expenditure, refinancing of loan and other corporate purposes. It added that the minimum loan amount offered by banks or financial institutions should be ₹500 crore or multiples of ₹500 crore.

274.title: DGCA imposes ₹25 lakh fine on 5 helicopter operators from Kedarnath
274.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) imposed a fine of ₹5 lakh each on five helicopter operators ferrying pilgrims to Kedarnath over irregularities in flying records, officials said. The DGCA also suspended officials of two other operators for three months over violation of safety norms, they added. The matter came to light after DGCA conducted an audit in June.

275.title: We're being open & honest about our interests: Jaishankar on India buying Russian oil
275.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar spoke about India's position on buying discounted Russian oil amid Moscow's ongoing war in Ukraine. He said, "We're not doing it in a defensive way. We're being very open and honest about our interests. I have a country which has a per capita income of $2,000...It's my obligation...to...ensure that I get [people] the best deal."

276.title: US President Biden signs $740-billion climate change, healthcare and tax bill into law
276.article_body: US President Joe Biden has signed a $740-billion climate change, healthcare and tax bill into law. The package, known as the Inflation Reduction Act, includes provisions that increase taxes on large corporations, address climate change and lower prescription drug costs. The estimated $740-billion package is made up of $440-billion in new spending and $300-billion towards easing deficits.

277.title: CNG price reduced by ₹6 per kg, PNG by ₹4 per SCM in Mumbai
277.article_body: Mahanagar Gas has reduced the prices of automobile fuel Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) and kitchen fuel Piped Natural Gas (PNG) in Mumbai. CNG price has been cut by ₹6 per kg and it will now cost ₹80 per kg. PNG price has been cut by ₹4 per standard cubic metre (SCM) and it will now cost ₹48.50 per SCM.

278.title: Bengaluru's Shivananda Circle flyover partially opens for commuters
278.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Monday opened one stretch of Shivananda Circle flyover for public as a trial run. Earlier, the flyover was expected to be inaugurated on August 15, however, due to recent rainfall, asphalting work on the flyover had not been completed. According to an official, rest of the work will be finished in 12-15 days.

279.title: Swine flu cases increase in Thane, death toll reaches 9
279.article_body: The number of swine flu cases is continuously increasing in Maharashtra's Thane district with the total number of cases going up to 342 and nine succumbing to it. At present, 144 patients are undergoing treatment for swine flu in Thane district which include 112 from Thane, 22 from Kalyan-Dombivali, nine from Navi Mumbai and one from Thane rural.

280.title: Passenger train collides with goods train in Maharashtra's Gondia, over 50 injured
280.article_body: More than 50 persons were injured after three bogies of a train derailed in Maharashtra's Gondia around 2.30 am on Wednesday morning. The accident took place following a collision between a goods train and a passenger train. No casualties have been reported so far. The train was on its way from Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur to Rajasthan's Jodhpur.

281.title: 'This is life', says China on India's concern about its 'spy' ship in Sri Lanka
281.article_body: Asked about India's concerns and the delay in the visit of the 'spy' ship Yuan Wang 5 to Sri Lanka, Beijing's envoy Qi Zhenhong said, "I don't know, you should ask Indian friends...Maybe this is life." China said the activities of its vessel will not affect the security of any country and should not be obstructed by any third party.

282.title: When I saw Mike Tyson on 'Liger' sets, I was like 'Oh f**k he's here': Vijay
282.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda revealed he was unsure if Mike Tyson would turn up for the shoot of his film 'Liger'. "I was in between a take, he was coming in his costume, I was like 'Oh f***, he's actually here'," Vijay added. Ananya Panday further stated Tyson would never sit in a room or a van while on 'Liger' sets.

283.title: 3 men run over by train while changing railway tracks in Gurugram
283.article_body: At least three carpenters, who went for a walk on railway tracks, were run over by a train in Gurugram, police said. "The deceased saw an approaching train...jumped across to the other track, where another passenger train was coming from the opposite direction," police added. "While changing the track, they didn't notice the second train...were run over," police further said.

284.title: Water supply in Hyderabad to be affected today over repair works
284.article_body: Parts of Hyderabad will be facing a water supply cut due to repair and maintenance work undertaken on water pipelines till 6 pm today. About 3.5 lakh residents are expected to be affected. While Mehdipatnam, Kakatiyanagar and Humayun Nagar will face partial cut, a complete water cut will be visible in areas including Mir Alam, Santoshnagar, Narayanguda and Adikmet.

285.title: Ramayan actress Dipika wrongly tags Pakistan PMO in Independence Day tweet
285.article_body: Ramayan actress Dipika Chikhlia wrongly tagged Pakistan PMO in her tweet on India's Independence Day. She shared a picture of herself holding the Tricolour, and wrote, "Happy Independence Day @PakPMO." The actress deleted the tweet after being trolled and posted a video on Instagram.

286.title: Twitter ordered to give Musk fired employee's bot data amid lawsuit
286.article_body: Twitter has been ordered to provide documents from one of its former employees to Elon Musk on bot accounts amid the lawsuit. Kayvon Beykpour, former consumer product head, was fired in May during his paternity leave. Musk's lawyers had requested documents from 22 Twitter employees whom they said had data on Twitter's process of analysing bot accounts.

287.title: I am buying Manchester United: Elon Musk
287.article_body: Tesla Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk on Tuesday said he is buying football club Manchester United. The team is controlled by the American Glazer family, who did not immediately respond to a request for comment. The football club had a market capitalisation of $2.08 billion, as of Tuesday's stock market close.

288.title: Tamil Nadu records 670 new COVID-19 cases, zero fatalities
288.article_body: Tamil Nadu recorded 670 new COVID-19 cases and zero fatalities in the last 24 hours, the Health Department said. So far, 35,60,161 COVID-19 cases have been reported in the state and the death toll remained at 38,033, as per a bulletin. With 927 recoveries in the last 24 hours, currently, there are 6,888 active infections.

289.title: Indian defence attaché now has unescorted access to Pentagon: US
289.article_body: US Air Force Secretary Frank Kendall has said the Indian defence attaché now has unescorted access to the Pentagon. He said the move is in line "with India's status as a major defence partner". "And if you don't think unescorted access to the Pentagon is a big deal, I can't get into the Pentagon without an escort," he said.

290.title: Everyone's become too critical: Huma on boycott culture against B'wood
290.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi said people have become "too negative" towards the Hindi film industry. "A few films have not worked and everyone is ready to write everyone's obituary," she said reacting to people's "critical" opinions on recent releases. She asked the audience to be "kinder" and wait for "good films". On the work front, Huma's upcoming release is 'Maharani 2'.

291.title: Shah, Nadda meet Bihar BJP core group as Nitish Kumar expands Cabinet
291.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah and BJP National President JP Nadda attended a Bihar BJP core committee meeting on Tuesday. The leaders were likely to discuss BJP's future course of action and the strategy for 2024 Lok Sabha polls, reports said. The meeting comes on the day CM Nitish Kumar expanded his Cabinet and 31 leaders were sworn-in as ministers.

292.title: Activist Teesta Setalvad moves SC seeking bail in Gujarat riots case
292.article_body: Social activist and journalist Teesta Setalvad has moved the Supreme Court seeking bail in the Gujarat riots case. The court will hear her bail petition on August 22. Setalvad was arrested for allegedly fabricating evidence to frame "innocent people" in the 2002 riots case. Earlier, an Ahmedabad sessions court denied bail to Setalvad and ex-DGP RB Sreekumar in the case.

293.title: Can't wait for audience to see your magic in Adipurush: Kriti to Saif
293.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon on Tuesday wished her 'Adipurush' co-star Saif Ali Khan on his birthday. "Happy Birthday, Saif! It's been a pleasure working with you and getting to know you," she wrote on Instagram Stories. She said she cannot wait for the audience to see Saif's "madness and magic" in 'Adipurush', which also stars Prabhas in a lead role.

294.title: Ajith to shoot AK61's final schedule in Visakhapatnam: Reports
294.article_body: Tamil actor Ajith Kumar has reportedly reached Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh on Tuesday to shoot for the final schedule of his upcoming film, which is tentatively titled 'AK61'. As per the reports, the crew has finished shooting 70% of the film, while they will soon complete the remaining. The H Vinoth directorial will see Ajith in a double role.

295.title: Wimbledon finalist Kyrgios opts out of Australia's Davis Cup team
295.article_body: Wimbledon finalist Nick Kyrgios has opted out of Australia's Davis Cup finals group stage team for next month. Kyrgios has skipped the team event since 2019. Australia are drawn in Pool C for the September 13-18 finals in Hamburg. "It would've been great to have...Kyrgios in...team but unfortunately he was unavailable for this tie," said team captain Lleyton Hewitt.

296.title: Home decor firm Sunday Design raises ₹12.5 cr in pre-Series A round
296.article_body: Furniture and home decor brand Sunday Design has raised ₹12.5 crore in a pre-Series A funding round. The capital was raised from QRG Investments & Holdings (the family office of Havells India Limited founders), Kama Group (family office of SRF Ltd) and KCT family office, among others. Since its launch, the brand claims to have recorded a 10% month-on-month growth.

297.title: CM Yogi Adityanath-led Cabinet approves UP Jail Manual 2022
297.article_body: The CM Yogi Adityanath-led UP Cabinet on Tuesday approved the proposal to release the UP Jail Manual 2022 which has incorporated guidelines issued by the Central government and courts periodically. This move means the British-era jail manual will be discarded. The old manual had obsolete provisions like transferring prisoners to the Andamans and separate lock-ups for European inmates.

298.title: There's a crisis of confidence in UN system today: Rajnath Singh
298.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, while virtually addressing the Moscow Conference on International Security, said the United Nations (UN) may 'lose its effectiveness' without democratising its decision-making. He said the major powers are refusing to change UN institutions as per the emerging geo-political realities. Singh added that there is a "crisis of confidence" today in the UN system.

299.title: Dearness allowance hiked by 6% for govt employees in Chhattisgarh
299.article_body: Chhattisgarh government on Tuesday announced a 6% hike in the dearness allowance (DA) for state government employees under the 7th Pay Commission. The DA has been hiked by 15% for people under the 6th Pay Commission. This will benefit almost 3.8 lakh people and put an additional burden of ₹2,160 crore/year on the state government exchequer, PTI reported.

300.title: New Polish school textbook draws criticism for fertility passage
300.article_body: A new high school textbook in Poland has attracted criticism from government critics as an attempted "indoctrination of young people". A passage on fertility in the book reads: "Increasingly sophisticated methods...lead to the treatment of sex as entertainment and fertility as human production...who will love the children thus produced?" Poland's Education Ministry has defended the book.

301.title: Both Gill and Dhawan are in good form, they can open in Zimbabwe: Kaif
301.article_body: Mohammad Kaif has said that both Shubman Gill and Shikhar Dhawan can open for India in the upcoming three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe as they are in good form, adding that KL Rahul can come down at number three. "Rahul needs match practice and he was injured...It's his wish where he wants to bat as he is captain," he added.

302.title: Making money is best defence against funding winter: Nandan Nilekani to startups
302.article_body: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani said that making money is best defence against funding winter  for startups. He added that startups need to focus on lowering the cost of acquiring customers and asked them to make money organically and not splurge on advertisements. In the wake of investments into India's startup ecosystem, Nilekani also advised companies to prioritise profitability over growth.

303.title: Akshay & Rakul Preet to shoot for a special dance number: Reports
303.article_body: Akshay Kumar and Rakul Preet Singh will reportedly shoot for a special dance number for their upcoming film. A report said that choreographer Ahmed Khan has been roped in to design the song, which will be shot in Kandivali, Mumbai. The film, which is tentatively titled 'Production No 41', is said to be the Hindi remake of Tamil film 'Ratsasan'.

304.title: Great performance: Vijender on Indian boxing contingent's 7 medals at CWG 2022
304.article_body: Olympic bronze medal-winning boxer Vijender Singh praised the Indian boxing contingent's performance at the recently concluded Commonwealth Games 2022, saying they delivered a "great" performance in Birmingham. India won three gold, one silver and three bronze medals. "I'm really proud of them," he added. Nikhat Zareen, Nitu Ghanghas and Amit Panghal won gold medals for India.

305.title: Paytm partners with Samsung, allows buy now, pay later at stores
305.article_body: Paytm has partnered with Samsung stores across the country to allow smart payments through its postpaid or buy-now-pay-later (BNPL) service with a credit limit of up to ₹60,000 per month. Paytm will deploy point-of-sale (POS) devices enabling consumers to purchase Samsung products through its payment instruments. No Cost EMI alternatives will also be available for POS device payments.

306.title: Samyukt Kisan Morcha rejects Centre's MSP panel meeting
306.article_body: The Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) leaders have said that they would not attend the upcoming meeting of the Centre's panel set up for making the Minimum Support Price (MSP) more effective. Calling the meeting a 'farce', the SKM said that it doesn't expect any conclusive result from it. The first meeting of the MSP panel is scheduled for August 22.

307.title: Russia fines Twitch ₹25.9 crore over 31-second 'fake' Ukraine clip
307.article_body: A Russian court has fined California-based streaming service Twitch two million roubles (₹25.9 crore) for allegedly hosting "fake" content related to its military campaign in Ukraine, local media reported. As per the reports, the court accused Twitch of failing to remove a 31-second clip of a girl from the Ukrainian town of Bucha. The content of the video wasn't specified.

308.title: Carlo Ancelotti picks France and Brazil as 2022 World Cup favourites
308.article_body: Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti has picked Brazil and defending champions France as his two favourite sides to win the 2022 FIFA World Cup. He added that Argentina were the other team to look out for because of Lionel Messi, while Spain, England and Germany were the dark horses. The tournament in Qatar will begin on November 20.

309.title: Never talked down to anyone: Bhogle as Ian Chappell retires from commentary
309.article_body: Talking about former Australia captain Ian Chappell retiring from commentary after 45 years, Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "Never pulled a punch, told it as it is, never talked down to anyone, wonderful professional & my role model for broadcasting work ethic." He added, "Was a privilege to work with him & I hope that proud voice is always heard."

310.title: 'Krrish 4' to introduce new characters: Reports
310.article_body: Hrithik Roshan's 'Krrish 4' will reportedly introduce new characters along with some new action sequences. As per reports, Rakesh Roshan is developing the script and is currently working on the crucial part of the story. The reports also claim that the new film will continue from where the third part of the superhero franchise ended.

311.title: Now it's cool: Kareena on notion that marriage ends actress' career
311.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has shared that people no more think that a marriage can end an actress' career. She said they now feel "it's cool to be married". Recalling how she was warned about her career before marrying Saif Ali Khan, Kareena said she "wanted to get married at that point of time" and it was not planned.

312.title: Fintech unicorn Razorpay acquires POS machines provider Ezetap
312.article_body: Razorpay, the B2B payments aggregator and neo-banking platform, has acquired point-of-sale (POS) machines provider Ezetap in a mix of primary and secondary transactions. With 80% stake in the parent company of Ezetap, this is Razorpay's fifth acquisition in four years. According to regulatory filings, Bengaluru-based Ezetap's early investor, Helion Ventures still has minority stake in the company.

313.title: ABTYP to hold world's biggest blood donation drive on PM's birthday
313.article_body: Akhil Bhartiya Terapanth Yuvak Parishad (ABTYP) is planning the world's biggest blood donation drive for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's birthday on September 17. The Parishad's President Pankaj Daga said they plan to set up 1,000 camps across India aiming to collect three lakh units of blood. A BJP leader present at the event said the party would support the drive.

314.title: Maha govt announces singing of national anthem at 11 am on Wed
314.article_body: The Maharashtra government has announced a collective singing of the national anthem at 11 am on Wednesday (August 17) across the state. As per the government resolution, participation is mandatory for government and private schools, colleges, educational institutes, university teachers and students. Further, the government has appealed to everyone from the state to join the event.

315.title: What does the FIFA suspension mean for Indian football?
315.article_body: With FIFA suspending AIFF, all domestic leagues in India stand officially unrecognised. Indian men's football team's friendly matches against Vietnam and Singapore will be cancelled if suspension isn't revoked. FIFA said 2022 Under-17 Women’s World Cup "cannot be held in India as planned". Indian Women's League champions Gokulam Kerala might also be barred from AFC Women’s Club Championship.

316.title: Madras HC gives actor Vijay temporary relief in income tax case
316.article_body: The Madras High Court has temporarily stayed the Income Tax Department's orders imposing a ₹1.5 crore penalty on actor Vijay for not disclosing ₹15 crore income in his 2016-17 IT returns. The court agreed with Vijay's arguments that the punitive action was time-barred. The department imposed the penalty after conducting a raid at the actor's residence in 2020.

317.title: We'll have our own show 'Cutting with Kashyap', jokes Anurag
317.article_body: Taapsee Pannu and Anurag Kashyap have shared why they will not make an appearance on Koffee with Karan season 7, hosted by Karan Johar. Kashyap joked that he will make a budget-friendly show of his own called 'Cutting With Kashyap'. He also suggested 'Tharra With Taapsee' and 'Panna With Pannu' as the titles for Taapsee's talk show.

318.title: Kejriwal promises free, quality education in poll-bound Gujarat
318.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said quality education will be provided free of cost if the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) wins the assembly elections in Gujarat. The AAP convener vowed to improve the infrastructure of government schools and open new ones. In earlier visits to poll-bound Gujarat, Kejriwal announced pre-poll guarantees on electricity, unemployment allowance and women's welfare.

319.title: Crystal Palace defender gets death threats over Liverpool striker's red card
319.article_body: Crystal Palace defender Joachim Andersen said he received death threats after his altercation with Liverpool's Darwin Nunez led to the striker getting a red card. "Got maybe 300-400 of these messages last night...have some respect and stop (acting) tough online," said Andersen on Instagram. Liverpool were held to a 1-1 draw as Nunez was sent off for head-butting Andersen.

320.title: I still think about Hamilton's 2021 championship loss every day: Toto Wolff
320.article_body: Mercedes F1 boss Toto Wolff admitted he still thinks about last year's Abu Dhabi Grand Prix where Lewis Hamilton lost the world championship to Red Bull's Max Verstappen on the last lap. "I think about it every day. But I have my peace with Max winning," said Wolff. He added he was happy with the FIA's new President and transparency.

321.title: 18 foetuses found at municipal dumping ground in West Bengal's Howrah
321.article_body: Ragpickers scavenging through waste found at least 18 foetuses in a municipal dumping yard in West Bengal's Howrah district, 40 km west of Kolkata, police said on Tuesday. Local residents said there are at least 30 hospitals and nursing homes within the yard's two-km radius. "Foetuses have been sent for postmortem. An investigation is going on," a police officer said.

322.title: Law making period products free for all takes effect in Scotland
322.article_body: Scotland said it has become the world's first country to ensure period products are available free of charge to all persons who need them. Scotland's Period Products Act came into force on Monday. Under the law, colleges, schools and local government bodies must make period products, such as tampons and sanitary pads, available in their bathrooms free of cost.

323.title: We are going to miss him: Dhawan on Sundar being ruled out of Zimbabwe tour
323.article_body: Commenting on Washington Sundar being ruled out of India's tour of Zimbabwe due to a shoulder injury, India vice-captain Shikhar Dhawan said the team is going to miss the all-rounder. "At the same time, we've got a good backup as well," he added. Sundar has been replaced by 27-year-old all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed. India-Zimbabwe will be playing three ODIs in Harare.

324.title: Stupid to ignore: England's Billings on Elgar questioning 'Bazball'
324.article_body: England wicketkeeper Sam Billings responded to South African batter Dean Elgar questioning the longevity of 'Bazball', saying, "You'd be pretty stupid to ignore that if I'm honest." He added that South Africa's defeat in the practice match should be a "wake-up call" as it wasn't even England's main XI. Elgar had said that 'Bazball' could "go south very quickly".

325.title: Looking forward to more work on OTT, but will never shut doors to TV: Drashti
325.article_body: Actress Drashti Dhami said she is glad that OTT has welcomed her so nicely and is looking forward to more work on the platform. She, however, added, "I can never shut my doors to TV, but right now, I'm just going with the flow." She further said, "In TV, we don't get to prepare for a role, here, we do."

326.title: Man walks into Assam police station with severed head
326.article_body: A man walked into a police station in Assam's Sonitpur district with a severed head, an official said on Tuesday. Tuniram Madri allegedly beheaded fellow villager Hem Ram after he lost a ₹500 bet on a local football match on Monday. Hem kept demanding the money and Tuniram killed him in a fit of rage, the official added.

327.title: 5 militants involved in IED blasts arrested in Manipur's Thoubal
327.article_body: Police said five militants of the banned outfit People's Liberation Army (PLA) involved in two Improvised Explosive Device (IED) blasts were arrested in Manipur's Thoubal district on Tuesday. A cordon and search operation was conducted at Tentha Tuwaband, during which three militants were arrested, Thoubal SP said. As a follow up operation, two more militants were also arrested, he added.

328.title: Assam woman realises flag in her closet is 90 yrs old, was used during freedom struggle
328.article_body: Assam's Kiron Rajhowa recently realised that the flag that has been in her possession for 40 years is 90 years old and was used during the freedom struggle by freedom fighter Podmeshwar Rajkhowa. Kiron's daughter-in-law Dolly realised the flag's heritage when it was given to Dolly's daughter. "We feel proud and privileged to have preserved this," Dolly said.

329.title: Gold worth ₹1.21 cr seized at Chennai airport from multiple incidents
329.article_body: Over two kg of gold worth ₹1.21 crore was seized from multiple incidents at the airport in Chennai, the Customs Department said on Tuesday. In one of the incidents, officials confiscated gold from a passenger who had concealed it in his rectum, the press release said. Electronic goods valued at ₹90,000 were recovered from all the incidents, the release added.

330.title: 'Uber charged ₹3,000 from Delhi airport to my house which was 45km away,' claims man
330.article_body: A Noida resident claimed that Uber charged him ₹2,935 for a cab from Delhi airport to his home, which was around 45 km away. "I was billed for 147.39 kms - halfway to Jaipur that I apparently covered in little over an hour!" he tweeted. "This, when...booking amount was ₹1,143. Pick-up and drop locations are inaccurate too!" the man added.

331.title: Tamil Nadu's DMK moves SC, challenges definition of 'freebies'
331.article_body: Tamil Nadu's ruling party DMK on Tuesday moved SC, challenging the definition of 'freebies'. The court is hearing a petition that has challenged the promise of freebies at election time, contending that the practice can bring financial ruin on a state. The DMK argued that free services are introduced with an intent to secure a "social order and economic justice".

332.title: 17-year-old Indian Grandmaster Praggnanandhaa defeats junior world number 1 Firouzja
332.article_body: India's 17-year-old Grandmaster Praggnanandhaa opened his campaign in the FTX Crypto Cup by defeating the junior world number one Alireza Firouzja. Praggnanandhaa won the four-game tie 2.5-1.5. He registered victories in the opening and the third game. He lost the second game, while the fourth game ended in a draw. He picked up three points for beating Firouzja.

333.title: Talaq-e-Hasan doesn't seem improper, women can opt for 'Khula' divorce: SC
333.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday observed that the Islamic practice of Talaq-e-Hasan, in which a man can divorce his wife by pronouncing 'talaq' once a month for three months, is "Prima Facie...not so improper". A two-judge bench said, "(In the practice,) women also have an option. 'Khula' is there." As per Islamic law, women can divorce their husbands through 'Khula'.

334.title: Adani Transmission becomes 15th Indian firm to cross ₹4 trillion in m-cap
334.article_body: Adani Transmission on Tuesday hit ₹4 trillion in market capitalisation for the first time after its shares rallied over 104% in 2022. It is the 15th Indian listed firm and the second Adani Group company to achieve this milestone. Adani Green Energy had become the first Adani Group company to reach ₹4 trillion in m-cap earlier this year.

335.title: PV Sindhu's coach Park Tae-sang leaves for Korea for back treatment
335.article_body: Indian shuttler PV Sindhu's coach Park Tae-sang has left for South Korea for back treatment. The 43-year-old revealed on Instagram that he had hurt his back during CWG 2022. "I'll get well treated and come back healthy. Stay healthy, everyone," he wrote. Earlier, Sindhu pulled out of Badminton World Championships due to a stress fracture on her foot.

336.title: Which 15 Indian companies have reached ₹4 trillion in m-cap?
336.article_body: Adani Transmission today became the 15th Indian company to reach ₹4 trillion in m-cap. It's the second Adani Group firm after Adani Green Energy to attain the milestone. Other Indian companies to reach ₹4 trillion in m-cap include Reliance Industries, TCS, HDFC Bank, Infosys, Hindustan Unilever, ICICI Bank, LIC, HDFC, SBI, Bajaj Finance, Bharti Airtel, Kotak Mahindra Bank and ITC.

337.title: Hope Team India can bank on me: Shahbaz after being picked for Zimbabwe tour
337.article_body: Reacting to his maiden India call-up in upcoming three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe, 27-year-old all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed said, "Everybody who plays cricket wants to wear the India colours." He added, "Given a chance I hope I can win matches for India with my batting and bowling. I hope...team can bank on me." Shahbaz replaced Washington Sundar following his shoulder injury.

338.title: Top Malaysian court orders former PM Najib to begin final appeal
338.article_body: Malaysia's top court has ordered former PM Najib Razak to begin his final appeal in two days in the 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) state fund scandal. The court rejected Najib's request for dismissal of his conviction and 12-year sentence over alleged judicial bias. Investigators have alleged that $4.5 billion was stolen from the 1MDB fund and laundered by Najib's associates.

339.title: 20-yr-old man dies after tree falls on him in UP's Firozabad
339.article_body: Police said that a 20-year-old aspirant preparing for a competitive examination, identified as Abhishek, died when a tree fell on him in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad on Tuesday. The incident took place while the victim was returning from his coaching classes. The tree fell on Abhishek due to high-speed wind near Labhua village, SP (rural) Akhilesh Narayan said.

340.title: Flood situation in Madhya Pradesh under control: CM Shivraj Chouhan
340.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has said that the flood situation in the state is currently under control. While assessing the flood situation, the CM said that due to excess rain, all dams in the Narmada catchment have been submerged. Talking about the state government's efforts, he added that many people were rescued from Vidisha and Balaghat districts.

341.title: Stale meat seized from Chennai mall's restaurants after surprise raid
341.article_body: After a surprise raid at multiple restaurants located inside a mall in Chennai's Anna Nagar, food safety authorities on Tuesday seized stale meat from a couple of them. "We received a complaint on Monday of poor quality food served at a restaurant here, in which a worm was found," said Dr Satheesh Kumar, who was leading the team of officials.

342.title: Losses from crypto hacks from Jan to Jul rose 60% YoY to $1.9 bn: Report
342.article_body: Losses arising from crypto hacks in 2022's first seven months jumped nearly 60% YoY to $1.9 billion, propelled by a surge in funds stolen from decentralised finance (DeFi) protocols, according to Chainalysis. In the same period last year, funds stolen from hacking amounted to $1.2 billion. "DeFi protocols are uniquely vulnerable to hacking," Chainalysis said in a blog post.

343.title: BJP doing double standard politics: Siddaramaiah on Shivamogga clashes
343.article_body: After communal clashes were reported in Karnataka's Shivamogga over the removal of Veer Savarkar's banner, Congress leader Siddaramaiah criticised BJP and accused it of being involved in double standard politics. "Why did they put Savarkar's photo in a Muslim area and remove Tipu Sultan's portrait?" Siddaramaiah questioned. "First BJP does all these things and blames Congress," Siddaramaiah added.

344.title: Mahagathbandhan formed out of selfish interests: Giriraj Singh
344.article_body: After the Bihar Cabinet expansion, Union Minister Giriraj Singh criticised the newly formed Mahagathbandhan and said this alliance is formed out of "selfish interests". "Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD in 2017. Now, for some reason or the other, he has gone back with RJD," Singh said. Nitish wishes to become a candidate for Prime Minister's post, Singh added.

345.title: Leave Kashmir or get killed: Kashmiri Pandit body to community
345.article_body: The Kashmiri Pandit Sangarash Samiti (KPSS) asked the community to leave the Valley after the targeted killing of a Kashmiri Pandit farmer by militants in Shopian. The KPSS President said that Pandits have "only one option- to leave Kashmir or get killed by religiously fanatic minds". He urged Kashmiri Pandits to move to safer places like Jammu and Delhi.

346.title: Bilkis rape convicts freed hrs after PM's women safety speech: Cong
