346.article_body: Congress spokesman Pawan Khera on Tuesday said that hours after PM Narendra Modi spoke about women's safety and respect on Independence Day, Gujarat government released 11 people convicted in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case. "Who's the real Narendra Modi? The one who serves falsehood from...the Red Fort or the one who gets his Gujarat government to release [rapists]?" Khera asked.

347.title: London’s Heathrow Airport increases limit on number of daily flyers
347.article_body: Amid a shortage of staff, London's Heathrow Airport has extended its limit on the number of passengers flying out daily to cope with soaring demand from travellers. The airport said a maximum of 100,000 flyers can depart from its terminals each day till October 29. As per initial plans, the daily cap was expected to be lifted on September 11.

348.title: KL Rahul will gain a lot from Zimbabwe tour ahead of Asia Cup 2022: Dhawan
348.article_body: India vice-captain Shikhar Dhawan said KL Rahul will gain a lot from India's tour of Zimbabwe ahead of Asia Cup 2022. Rahul is returning to international cricket in the upcoming ODI series after not having played in any format of cricket following IPL 2022 due to fitness issues. Rahul will lead India in the three-match series in Harare, beginning Thursday.

349.title: Wanted Chinese online gambling operator arrested in Thailand
349.article_body: Thai police on Monday told Reuters that they had arrested a Chinese fugitive wanted by Beijing over allegations of running illegal online gambling operations. The process to extradite 40-year-old She Zhijiang to China is underway, police added. She Zhijiang was arrested last week based on an international warrant and an Interpol red notice, a police spokesperson informed.

350.title: Your heart breaks: Gaurav on his role being chopped in 'Bachchhan Paandey'
350.article_body: Actor Gaurav Chopraa opened up about his role being chopped in 'Bachchhan Paandey' and said, "Aapka dil thoda tutt ta hain (your heart breaks)...Didn’t know what to say about it." "There were a few things that I did jiske liye taaliyan baji set pe (that were applauded on the set)...you want that to reach the audience," he said.

351.title: 6 injured in clash in Assam's Lakhimpur; AASU stages road blockade
351.article_body: A group of miscreants allegedly attacked a Village Defence Party (VDP) in Assam's Lakhimpur district, injuring six VDP members in the area bordering Arunachal Pradesh. Following the incident, the All Assam Students' Union (AASU) staged a road blockade along the main highway leading to Arunachal Pradesh.

352.title: Not going to be easy: Maninder on Deepak Chahar's India comeback
352.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Maninder Singh said that the Indian team management should handle Deepak Chahar with care as it'll not be easy for the pacer to make a comeback in international cricket after returning from a hamstring injury. Chahar, who hasn't played since February 2022 due to injury, is named in India's 15-member squad for upcoming three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe.

353.title: All Tyagis aren't bad, I trust PM and Yogi: Woman abused by Shrikant
353.article_body: Days after a Noida woman was abused and pushed by alleged BJP member Shrikant Tyagi, the woman posted a video saying not all 'Tyagis' are bad and that she trusts PM Modi and Yogi Adityanath. "Aisa nahi hai ki saare BJP waale kharab hai," she said, adding that PM Modi and Yogi Adityanath have done wonders for the country.

354.title: Men plant bomb under Punjab Sub-Inspector's car, act caught on CCTV
354.article_body: Punjab Sub-Inspector Dilbag Singh on Tuesday said that a bomb was planted under his car in Amritsar. A CCTV footage showed two men arriving on a motorcycle and purportedly planting the bomb under the parked car. "I've worked during militancy...that is why they [planted the bomb]," Singh said. "Police recovered the IED...Further probe underway," Manish Chawla, IG Border Range, said.

355.title: Can’t let our guards down: Delhi L-G as COVID-19 cases rise again
355.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has appealed to the people to 'not let their guards down' as the COVID-19 pandemic is "far from over". "We are witnessing a rise in COVID-19 infections...We cannot afford to let our guards down," tweeted Saxena. Delhi, on Monday, logged 1,227 fresh COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 14.57%.

356.title: Which Made-in-India weapons were handed over to the Indian Army today?
356.article_body: Several indigenously-developed defence systems and weapons were handed over by the Defence Minister to the Army, including the F-INSAS, the Nipun anti-personnel mines and the Landing Craft Assault (LCA). The F-INSAS (Future Infantry Soldier As A System) aims to increase the operational capability of a soldier. The LCA will be used as a replacement for boats in Ladakh's Pangong Tso.

357.title: Man who blackmailed Urfi Javed for cyber sex, threatened to cyber rape her arrested
357.article_body: Actress and 'Bigg Boss OTT' fame Urfi Javed on Tuesday said in an interview that the man who blackmailed her for cyber sex and threatened to cyber rape her has been arrested. She also took to Instagram Stories to share the picture of the man and thanked Mumbai Police. Urfi had alleged the man had been harassing her for years.

358.title: US needs conflicts to retain hegemony: Putin on Ukraine war
358.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday accused the US of encouraging extended hostilities in Ukraine so as to maintain its global hegemony. Putin said, "They need conflicts to retain their hegemony...That's why they have turned the Ukrainian people into cannon fodder." Putin was speaking at a security conference attended by representatives from Asia, Africa and Latin America.

359.title: BJP misusing paramilitary, police to transport money: Raj CM
359.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday accused BJP of misusing paramilitary and police forces to transport money to its party headquarters. "Even if a road is made of gold, just bring Hindu-Muslim angle during elections and win. They are in this arrogance, which will not last long," he said. "Pett roti maangta hai," CM Gehlot added.

360.title: 2019 corporate tax rate cut led to ₹1.84L cr revenue loss: Congress
360.article_body: Congress on Tuesday asked why the BJP government reduced the corporate tax rate from 30% to 22% in 2019. Quoting a Parliamentary estimates report, Congress spokesperson Gaurav Vallabh said the reduction led to a negative revenue impact of ₹1.84 lakh crore. "Why are such rate cuts limited to corporates, why the middle class is taxed at...30%," he asked.

361.title: Gemini North telescope captures image of 2 galaxies merging
361.article_body: The Gemini North telescope in Hawai'i captured a brilliant image of a pair of spiral galaxies, NGC 4568 and NGC 4567, merging into one another. Both the galaxies that are entangled in their mutual gravitational fields may eventually combine to form a single elliptical galaxy in around 500 million years. The cosmic collision took place approximately 60 million light-years away.

362.title: Malayalam actor Nedumbram Gopi dies at 85
362.article_body: Veteran Malayalam actor Nedumbram Gopi, 85, passed away on Tuesday due to age-related ailments. He made his acting debut with the award-winning film 'Kazhcha', which also starred Mammooty in the lead role. In the Blessy directorial, Nedumbram Gopi played the role of a father and a grandfather for which he received wide appreciation.

363.title: Delhi-bound Taj Express evacuated, searched after fake bomb threat
363.article_body: Passengers of the Delhi-bound Taj Express were asked to deboard at Mathura and the train was searched for two hours after a passenger received a bomb threat. Police said the caller claimed a bomb was placed in Taj Express' D2 coach and that it would explode when the train reached Delhi. A 45-year-old man has been arrested in the matter.

364.title: Akshay wishes Saif on b'day by dancing on 'Main Khiladi...' song
364.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar wished Saif Ali Khan on his birthday with a video wherein he can be seen performing on 'Main Khiladi Tu Anari' song, which he is recreating for his upcoming film 'Selfiee'. Sharing the video on Instagram, Akshay said the song "brings back fondest memories", especially of his "partner-in-crime" Saif. The original song starred Akshay and Saif.

365.title: Over 5,500 cases of discrimination reported in Germany in 2021
365.article_body: Germany's Anti-Discrimination Commissioner Ferda Ataman on Tuesday said 5,617 cases of discrimination were reported in the country in 2021, which was the second highest figure for a 12-month period since the agency's inception in 2006. Of all cases, 37% were connected to race and 32% were related to disability and diseases. "The number of discrimination cases...is alarming," Ataman said.

366.title: Savarkar's poster torn in K'taka's Tumakuru day after clashes in Shivamogga
366.article_body: A group of men allegedly tore down a banner that had a photo of Vinayak Damodar Savarkar in Karnataka's Tumakuru city on Tuesday. The incident comes a day after communal clashes were reported in Shivamogga district after another group removed a poster of Savarkar and put up one of Tipu Sultan on Independence Day.

367.title: Centre considering transfer of 4 Gujarat villages to UT of Dadra
367.article_body: The Union Home Ministry is holding discussions to transfer four villages and a piece of land from Gujarat to the Union Territory of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu. Meghval, Nagar, Raymal and Madhuban villages in South Gujarat are more accessible from Diu. The Union Territory has demanded the land in Saurashtra to develop a fishing port.

368.title: Felt like a princess: Arjun Kanungo's wife Carla on mehndi outfit
368.article_body: South African model Carla Dennis, who recently got married to Indian singer Arjun Kanungo, chose to wear designer Anita Dongre's creation for her mehndi function. Describing her fuchsia pink outfit, Carla said, "I loved it the minute I saw it." She said she "felt like an absolute princess" in the lehenga. Carla and Arjun got married on August 10.

369.title: Sabotage behind ammunition depot blast in Crimea, says Russia
369.article_body: Russia has blamed saboteurs for the series of explosions that hit an ammunition depot in annexed Crimea on Tuesday. This comes as a rare admission by Russia that pro-Ukraine groups are damaging its military infrastructure in territories under its control. Notably, Kyiv had hinted at a possible Ukrainian involvement in explosions that rocked a Russian-operated airbase in Crimea last week.

370.title: 2 men detained over murder of CPI(M) worker in Kerala's Palakkad
370.article_body: Two men have been detained in connection with the murder of 40-year-old CPI(M) worker K Shajahan in Kerala's Palakkad district. "We have...got a definite lead about six others who directly participated in the crime," Palakkad SP R Viswanadh said. "The real motive behind the crime can be established only after a detailed investigation," the SP added.

371.title: US First Lady Jill Biden tests positive for COVID-19
371.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden tested positive for COVID-19 after developing cold-like symptoms late on Monday evening, her communications director Elizabeth Alexander said on Tuesday. After testing negative earlier on Monday as part of her regular testing cadence, a PCR test taken after she developed symptoms came back positive. She is only experiencing mild symptoms.

372.title: Tencent stops sales on its NFT platform Huanhe a year after launch
372.article_body: Tencent on Tuesday announced that its non-fungible token (NFT) platform Huanhe will no longer release digital collectibles. Tencent said users of Huanhe, launched in August 2021, will still be able to hold, display or request for refund of their existing collectibles. Huanhe is making adjustments to its business based on its consideration to focus on its core strategy, Tencent said.

373.title: Restoration underway after Lucknow's Bara Imambara dome collapses
373.article_body: The restoration work on the dome of Lucknow's Bara Imambara, which collapsed on Monday evening, is currently underway. An Archaeological Survey of India official said that the work on the small structure will be completed in a day or two. The dome collapsed due to heavy rainfall and wind around 6 pm on Monday.

374.title: 'Vulgar' songs played in IIT-BHU after flag hoisting, probe ordered
374.article_body: 'Vulgar' Bhojpuri songs were allegedly played after the Independence Day flag hoisting ceremony at the Indian Institute of Technology- Banaras Hindu University (IIT-BHU). The administration has ordered a probe into the incident. An official said that after the ceremony, some youths played 'vulgar' Bhojpuri songs and danced before the staff paused the music and asked that the venue be evacuated.

375.title: Anurag Kashyap shares pic with ex-wives Kalki Koechlin & Aarti Bajaj, says 'My 2 pillars'
375.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap took to Instagram on Tuesday to share a picture with his ex-wives Kalki Koechlin and Aarti Bajaj. "My two pillars," he wrote in the caption of the post. While Anurag and Aarti were married from 1997 to 2009, the director and Kalki were married from 2011 and 2015. "Iconic," commented Aaliyah Kashyap, Anurag's daughter with Aarti.

376.title: It hurt him, really tore him to shreds: Karthik on Rohit being dropped from Tests in 2018
376.article_body: Recalling the time when Rohit Sharma was dropped from India's Test squad for England tour in 2018, wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said, "He was sent back after the white-ball leg and that really hurt him." "Rohit did not see that coming and that really tore him to shreds," the 37-year-old added.

377.title: Drunk guard caught molesting girls at Delhi hostel, CCTV footage emerges
377.article_body: An intoxicated security guard molested and thrashed girls at a PG hostel in Delhi's Karol Bagh, Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal said on Tuesday. She also shared CCTV footage of the alleged incident where the guard is seen molesting a girl who is seen resisting. DCW has issued a notice to police, Maliwal said.

378.title: Zimbabwe playing good cricket, will keep us on our toes: Dhawan ahead of 1st ODI
378.article_body: Ahead of the first India-Zimbabwe ODI in Harare, India vice-captain Shikhar Dhawan said the hosts are playing good cricket and it will keep the visitors on their toes. "We would not take anything for granted. We are here to perform," he added. First ODI will be played on Thursday. Zimbabwe won the recently concluded three-match ODI series against Bangladesh 2-1.

379.title: 30% shows of 'Laal...' & 'Raksha Bandhan' cancelled due to no audience
379.article_body: Around 30% of the morning shows of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan' were reportedly cancelled by the exhibitors across the country on Tuesday due to no audience. "It's a dark black weekend," an exhibitor said as quoted by Bollywood Hungama, "Both Aamir Khan and Akshay Kumar have to introspect on their choices of films," the exhibitor added.

380.title: Mandla is India's first functionally literate district: MP Minister
380.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's tribal-dominated Mandla has become India's first "functionally literate" district, declared state minister Bisahulal Singh. The District Collector said it was the result of a campaign launched after locals complained of being defrauded due to illiteracy. A person can be called functionally literate when they are able to write their own name, count, read and write in Hindi.

381.title: 3 techies, cab driver returning from Udaipur trip die in car crash
381.article_body: Three techies, who visited Udaipur for a trip, died while returning after a speeding truck struck their cab in Gurugram on Tuesday. The 35-year-old cab driver from Noida also died in the crash. One of the deceased's friends, who was also in the vehicle, has sustained multiple injuries, police said. The truck lost control and overturned on the victims' vehicle.

382.title: If I lose 2,000 points, I'll start again: US Open defending champ Raducanu
382.article_body: Speaking about the pressure of having to defend 2,000 ranking points at upcoming US Open, defending champion Emma Raducanu said, "If I lose 2,000 points so be it, I'll start again from the bottom." She added, "I know I can do something that no one else has done. I qualified and won...US Open, so I can start from the beginning."

383.title: PETA seeks to ban dog breeding for illegal fighting in UP
383.article_body: The People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) India has asked to ban the keeping, breeding and sale of dogs for illegal fighting in Uttar Pradesh. PETA has also asked that illegal pet shops and breeders be shut down. According to the organisation, the ban can be achieved by owners mandatorily sterilising the breeds placed on the prohibited list.

384.title: Shameful: Anupam Kher on Kashmiri Pandit man's killing
384.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher condemned the killing of a Kashmiri Pandit man by terrorists in Kashmir's Shopian and said, "(It's) shameful that atrocities on Kashmiri Pandits continue...They're killing their own people." He added that terrorists were "killing everyone who stands with India". Kher said the more the actions were condemned, "the less it is" and that mindset needs to be changed.

385.title: Bollywood stars should reduce fee for focus on good cinema: BJP
385.article_body: Responding to reports of several Hindi films underperforming at the box office, BJP's Syed Zafar Islam on Tuesday said that Bollywood stars should reduce their fee to allow producers to focus on good cinema. "Remember, OTT is a better and cost-effective option available to people", he said, adding that the full industry is going through a lean phase post-COVID-19.

386.title: Air India announces launch of direct flight between Pune & Ahmedabad
386.article_body: Air India has announced the launch of direct flight between Pune and Ahmedabad with effect from August 20, 2022, to cater to the growing demand for air connectivity between the smart cities. "This new addition is set to improve Air India's domestic connectivity and empower our customers with more travel options," MD and CEO of Air India Campbell Wilson stated.

387.title: 6-yr-old raped & murdered in Haryana's Panipat, migrant worker held
387.article_body: A 40-year-old migrant worker was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly raping and murdering a six-year-old girl in Haryana's Panipat. Police said the accused hailed from Uttarakhand's Chamoli and was living in Panipat for 15 years. The accused said he lured the girl on the pretext of buying her biscuits while she was playing and took her to a deserted place.

388.title: Rhine's low water levels threatening industry: German lobby group
388.article_body: Amid drought in Europe, Germany's main industry lobby group on Tuesday said that factories may have to slow down production or cease it completely as Rhine river's dwindling water levels are hampering transportation of cargo. Lobby group BDI further said that transporting cargo through other means was difficult due to limited rail capacity and a lack of drivers.

389.title: Serena Williams is one of the greatest athletes, male or female: McEnroe
389.article_body: Praising Serena Williams, ex-world number one John McEnroe said the 23-time Grand Slam champion, for him, is the greatest female athlete in the history of sports. "I don't care who you could come up with. She's one of the greatest athletes period, male or female," he added. The 40-year-old will be retiring after the US Open 2022.

390.title: Plane from India with 12 people lands in Pak for unknown reason: Report
390.article_body: A charter airplane carrying 12 passengers from India landed at Pakistan's Jinnah International Airport in Karachi on August 15, Geo News reported. The flight took off shortly after arriving in Karachi, with 12 passengers on board. Confirming the incident, a Civil Aviation Authority spokesperson said the flight had no connection with Pakistan. It's unclear why it had landed in Karachi.

391.title: New study reveals when the Sun is estimated to die
391.article_body: The Sun at the centre of our solar system is "currently in its comfortable middle age", new data from the European Space Agency's (ESA) GAIA spacecraft has said. The current age of the Sun is estimated to be 4.57 billion years, data showed. It will die after becoming a red giant star when it's around 10-11 billion years old.

392.title: Doesn't seem Dalit boy was thrashed for touching water pot: Raj Police
392.article_body: The nine-year-old Dalit boy, who died after he was beaten up at his school in Rajasthan, doesn't appear to have been thrashed for touching his teacher's drinking water pot, Jalore SP HV Agarwalla said. "Most of the students in the school are from SC/ST communities and so is half the staff," said Jogeshwar Garg, BJP MLA from Jalore.

393.title: 40-yr-old Ghaziabad builder cheats 31 investors of over ₹10 cr, held
393.article_body: A 40-year-old man was arrested from West Delhi by officers of the Economic Offences Wing of the Delhi Police last week, for allegedly cheating 31 investors of over ₹10 crore, police said on Tuesday. The accused's company took money from people for shops and flats at a plot in Haryana but escaped after promising possession within 27 months to investors.

394.title: 1,100 Rohingya refugees living in Delhi tents to be shifted to flats
394.article_body: Around 1,100 Rohingya refugees, currently residing in tents in Delhi's Madanpur Khadar area,  will be shifted into New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) flats, officials said on Tuesday. The decision was taken at a meeting chaired by Chief Secretary of Delhi Naresh Kumar. The flats, located in Bakkarwala village, will be equipped with basic amenities and round-the-clock security, officials said.

395.title: Rohit asked to go inside restaurant after massive crowd gathers to see him, video viral
395.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing a massive crowd gathering outside a restaurant in Mumbai to get a glimpse of Team India captain Rohit Sharma. In the video, Rohit can be seen exiting the restaurant and being immediately asked by the security personnel to go inside due to the amount of people blocking the road.

396.title: Nitish betrayed Tejashwi Yadav too: Sushil Modi after cabinet expansion
396.article_body: After the cabinet expansion of the newly formed Mahagathbandhan government in Bihar, BJP Rajya Sabha MP Sushil Kumar Modi said Nitish Kumar has betrayed Tejashwi Yadav by keeping Home and Finance portfolios with the JD(U). "What message does Nitish Kumar want to give by keeping people like Surendra Yadav, Ramanand Yadav and Lalit Yadav in the cabinet," Sushil Modi tweeted.

397.title: Around 600 Chinese manjha rolls seized in Delhi, 5 shopkeepers held
397.article_body: Five men were arrested by Northeast Delhi Police Saturday, for allegedly possessing and selling nearly 600 rolls of banned Chinese manjha in the Jafrabad and Bhajanpura areas. One of the accused reportedly confessed that he had been collecting the manjha rolls from his sources for some time so that he could sell them at a higher rate on Independence Day.

398.title: Liquor shop cashier hacked to death in TN; incident caught on camera
398.article_body: A video showing a group of miscreants murdering a state-owned liquor store's cashier on Monday in Tamil Nadu's Sirumugai has surfaced online. According to reports, many men holding machetes and knives stormed the wine store where the victim worked. The video shows approximately six assailants attacking the victim with sharp-edged instruments, who then allegedly hacked him to death.

399.title: Delhi court acquits man from charges of possessing heroin, liquor
399.article_body: A Delhi court has acquitted a man, accused of carrying illicit liquor and possessing heroin, saying there were "major contradictions" in the deposition of the prosecution witnesses. Special Judge Deepak Wason, in an order, also said that the police showed "deliberate disregard" of the statutory procedures during its probe and gave the accused benefit of the doubt.

400.title: Drugs worth ₹1,026 cr seized after Mumbai Police busts mephedrone unit
400.article_body: Mumbai Police have busted a mephedrone, or MD, manufacturing unit in Gujarat and seized 513 kg of the synthetic drug worth ₹1,026 crore, an official said on Tuesday. The Anti-Narcotics Cell also arrested Giriraj Dixit, the owner of the drug unit who holds a master's degree in Chemistry. The unit was raided on August 13 and was located in Ankleshwar.
